Buscamos un Data Scientist para nuestras oficinas en Madrid con al menos 5 años de experiencia que quiera desarrollarse profesionalmente en una gran empresa, y colaborar en proyectos que tienen un impacto real en la sociedad. Si tienes curiosidad por saber cómo sería tu futuro en Santander… esto no ha hecho más que empezar. Lo primero es presentarnos En Santander Digital Services, la tecnología es fundamental para todo lo que hacen nuestros clientes y empleados. Mediante la innovación continua, trabajando con metodologías Agile y DevSecOps, adoptamos las tecnologías más top del mercado para trabajar con el mejor stack tecnológico. Hemos recibido la distinción “Top Employer” a nivel España, Europa y Global por sexto año consecutivo y estamos muy orgullosos de ser una organización donde hay igualdad de oportunidades. Estamos formando un equipo dinámico y proactivo. Solo queremos que traigas buen rollo, compromiso con la sociedad y que compartas nuestros valores, nos da igual de dónde vengas o a dónde vayas ¿Qué estamos buscando? Estamos buscando un Data Scientist , un rol clave de nuestro ecosistema tecnológico. Nuestro trabajo consiste en analizar, transformar y explotar la información del banco para cumplir los requisitos comerciales de negocio y mejorar nuestros resultados. Siendo capaces de analizar e interpretar tendencias o patrones. Usando siempre tecnologías modernas y los principios de diseño para desarrollar un código de calidad, alineado con el framework del Santander (seguridad, arquitectura, testing...). Buscamos perfiles: Con experiencia en el mundo del dato, que nos ayuden a convertir Santander en la mejor plataforma tecnológica de servicios financieros. Qué esperamos de ti: Seguro que encajas en el equipo si te gusta la tecnología, quieres entender los riesgos a los que se enfrenta el Banco, aprendes constantemente de nuevas tecnologías y si además de desarrollar tus skills técnicos, también te preocupas de mejorar tus soft skills (capacidad de comunicación, espíritu crítico, iniciativa y ganas de aprender). Si tienes el espíritu, estos son los puntos indispensables que miraremos en tu CV: Grado superior que te permita tener una base sobre la que construir tu desarrollo y aportar en tu trabajo. Mas de 5 años de experiencia en Data Scientist. Valoramos que tengas un nivel alto de inglés (B2 al menos). Buen manejo de herramientas ofimáticas. Conocimientos de integración y gestión de datos con grandes volúmenes de datos. Creación de modelos basados en data-driven para la toma de decisiones. Modelos predictivos y métricas de negocio. Creación de dashboards para la visualización de datos. Conocimientos de estadística, métricas digitales y análisis cuantitativos/cualitativos de los datos. Y estas las skills que te sumarán puntos: Experiencia en departamentos de tecnología/datos, o en ámbitos relacionados. Experiencia en gestión de equipos. Ecosistemas complejos. Pensamiento analítico y lógico. En qué vas a aportar valor: Desarrollando soluciones y manteniendo los productos de IT de la tribu de Seguros conforme a las políticas del Grupo y los estándares técnicos del sector de IT donde prime: El rendimiento, la usabilidad, la simplicidad de las soluciones y la creatividad en coordinación con los equipos de negocio y operaciones. La automatización tests/despliegues sobre controles en diferentes entornos y plataformas. El foco en el nivel de servicio, minimizando las incidencias y consultas de los clientes. Además, como parte de un equipo de trabajo, colaborarás en: Aportar las conclusiones de tu trabajo y aprender de las conclusiones de tus compañeros. Interactuar con los equipos de negocio y operaciones para entender qué prioridades de desarrollo tenemos, qué controlan, qué proyectos tienen y qué iniciativas son prioritarias. Buscando anticipar proactivamente las mejoras necesarias para la evolución del producto. Interactuar con los equipos de tecnología del CIO, CTO y CISO para apoyarnos en la mejora del nivel de servicio, el desarrollo sobre la mejor arquitectura y minimizar el riesgo operativo y tecnológico. Cómo trabajarás con nosotros: ¡¡¡En equipo!!! Con compañeros dinámicos, proactivos y abiertos al cambio. Modelo híbrido de trabajo (teletrabajas unos días y otros te juntas con tu equipo en la oficina). Flexibilidad horaria para entrar y salir. Posibilidad de viajar (colaboración con países) y colaborar con equipos de esos países. Oportunidades internacionales para desarrollarte en diferentes unidades y países. Formación continua en temas técnicos e innovadores para siempre estar al día y poder desarrollar tu trabajo. Plan de carrera para que crezcas profesionalmente y veas recompensado tu esfuerzo y trabajo. Salario y bonus muy competitivo Beneficios sociales (tipos de interés especiales para préstamos, condiciones bancarias preferentes, plan de pensiones, seguro de vida, etc.) Beneficios sociales y más cosas que te contaremos cuando llegues! Si quieres conocer más sobre la tecnología que desarrollamos en Santander o ver otras ofertas, visita nuestra página www.betechwithsantander.com
beneficios: ['Formación continua', 'Plan de jubilación', 'Plan de pensiones', 'Seguro de vida']

descripcion: Who You'll Work With You will join our Madrid office for 4-8 weeks during the summer. As a data scientist intern in our McKinsey Analytics team, QuantumBlack, you will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects. This global practice supports clients in many different industries facing challenges of developing and implementing tailored concepts for prediction and prescription. Applications for Summer Internship 2024 are now open. What You'll Do You will focus on the development of advanced analytics models to optimize underlying business problems. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and use that data in creative ways. You will create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations. You will create valuable, transformative business strategies through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data. You will apply and advise on state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions. Additionally, you will review, support and advise on the day-to-day analytics requirements of clients’ key operational processes while continually improving the impact of these processes. Our Tech Stack While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more! Qualifications Student in penultimate year of studies Background in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering 0-1 year of professional experience in programming; experience applied to business problems is a plus Knowledge in programming (focus on machine learning) Python (must), R (highly valued), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued) Statistical knowledge is a plus Demonstrated aptitude for analytics Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and Spanish Knowledge of other languages including Portuguese, German, French and Italian will be valued

En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres. Buscamos un/a Data Scientist Stager ¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO? Como Data Scientist, formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail. Desarrollarás soluciones punteras de ciencia de datos y aprendizaje automático para habilitar casos de uso muy innovadores en el sector retail, como geoanalítica, robotización, personalización omnicanal, la tienda omnicanal, consumidor 360º y decisiones en tiempo real. ¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO? Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales. Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos. Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecha las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción. Trabajarás con AWS services como S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, etc. Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería en un equipo formado por Data Scientist, Data Engineers, Data Architects y desarrolladores full stack. ¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI? Que estés estudiando un Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas o Estadística o Ciencia de Datos con buenos resultados académicos. Que tengas conocimiento sobre Data Modelling y SQL. Tengas capacidad para programar (o facilidad de aprendizaje) en Python, R o Scala. ¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES? Formarás parte de una empresa internacional en plena transformación tecnológica, como parte del equipo de Data & Advanced Analytics de Mango. 6 meses de prácticas (remuneradas). Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales. Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%. You got it? We like you!

Hello! We have new job opportunities for you at MBC, would you like to join us? We are looking for a Data Scientist for a Regulatory Reporting Analyst role.  About MBC May Business Consulting is a dynamic international consulting firm offering digital transformation advisory, specialized change management, efficiency and control. We have a completely client-centric approach, we engage 100% proactively to maximize our added value. Our differentiated business model allows us to efficiently help our clients improve service levels and reduce costs.  We are located in Spain and the UK, and work on international projects with financial institutions, banks, fintechs and startups. We are currently in a moment of expansion and growth so we would like to increase our area of consultants.  About the Profile We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team of consultants and participate in international projects in financial entities and fintechs. As a Regulatory Reporting Analyst, you will perform Controls, follow up meetings and KPIs ensuring appropiate compliance for different Regulations.  Functions: Analyze Regulatory processes identifying improvement points. Manage different databases from the analytical point of view to obtain conclusions. Escalate any potential issues or regulatory breaches to the Management in order to implement actions plans proposing solutions. Execute controls, follow up issues and sistemic KPIs calculations. Interaction with Management and other Geographies.  Requirements: We will consider experience in Regulatory Affairs (i.e. MiFID II, EMIR, DFA, SFTR, etc), Regulatory Compliance or Internal Audit. or Data Scientis with expertise in high-volume data management. Education in Business Administration, Engineering, Economics or Law. Strong process and data analytical skills. Use tools for managing data as: SQL, PowerBI, Python. Knowledge of Regulatory Affairs related to investment products (i.e. MiFID II, EMIR o CRS-FATCA) will be appreciated. Fluent English is a must. Better if you have... Proactivity Eagerness to excel. Empathy and ability to work as part of a team. Learning capacity and attention to detail Customer oriented.  We offer: Open compensation package: We adapt to your experience and expectations. Flexible remuneration: medical insurance, restaurant vouchers, training, etc. Free training to help you in your professional growth. Free English classes depending on your level. Participate in various interesting projects with an international focus and in a continuously growing sector.  Location: Madrid (hybrid) Join a young consulting company and continue to grow and develop professionally. Work in international projects with a great working environment.  We look forward to your application!

COMPANY STUFF ABOUT BIG and BIG DECISIONS This exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist will have you helping to shape data, owning and presenting your own work demonstrating transformational insight to our business and our clients’ businesses - and pushing the boundaries of data being at the core of our initiatives. Our aim is to use the wealth of data that we have and that our clients have, to create predictions, insights and recommendations. This starts with an exciting project to predict opportunity in our base, and will include bespoke work for our clients based on their 1P data. WHAT YOU'LL DO Build analytical products You will be responsible, in collaboration with the Head of Decision Science, other Data Scientists and Data Engineers, for building a range of products that will enable us to understand customers, prospects and the changing market; to predict next best actions and identify opportunities; to plan and optimize the customer journey, among others. This role will require a combination of creativity, analytical thinking, and pragmatism to make best use of the data we have access to. Support our teams Our clients rely on quality data to optimize the communications they have with clients, customers and prospects. You will help them by enhancing the data they already have, producing derived insights, and give them the information they need to encourage engagement and conversion. Support our clients Our clients hold a wealth of historic 1P data. You will be involved in unlocking the potential of their data, identifying cross-sell and up-sell opportunities among existing customers, and supporting them with insights about customer behaviour, journeys and next best experiences. Key Responsibilities This role requires a good understanding of all phases of the analytic process including data collection, preparation, modelling, evaluation, and insight generation. The creative use of data/data sources is a must; you should have not only a strong analytical mind but also to be resourceful when it comes to solving problems with data. You will be working with data engineers, who will support you in shaping and manipulating the data for you to use. You must therefore be collaborative and clear in your instructions, and capable of producing briefs that will support these engineers in their work. You will also be expected to present your work to non-technical audiences, stressing the business benefits and recommendations. You will demonstrate a high level of expertise in the use of machine learning and statistical techniques. Skills in deep learning, data mining, knowledge extraction and graph theory are also highly desirable. Experience working on B2B clients, tech, telecommunications and IT would be advantageous but not all essential. WHAT YOU'LL BRING Essential: - Experience with both descriptive and predictive analytic techniques including clustering, regression, classification methods, etc. (Data Mining /Machine Learning); - Data extraction from structured/unstructured sources; extracts data from API’s across a range of social platforms – JSON, XML; - Experience of analysing audio data (from our call recordings), to better understand the conversations that have been held with our customers, and to use this information to: Profile the contacts we are speaking to Identify what works and what doesn’t: key words, tone, sentiment Profile our callers, and investigate which caller profiles work best with the contact profiles Identify and flag opportunities - Good data manipulation skills using SQL based databases; - Experience building customer-level marketing and analytic tools including customer segmentation and performing predictive modelling; - Experience with data visualization and analytic techniques using tools such as Python/R (for visualization purposes), Tableau, Power BI; - Understanding of Text Mining, Natural Language Processing Nice to have: - Preference for candidates with experience working for B2B clients, especially in IT / tech / telecoms - Experience working with Big Data, cloud based and open source technologies including Apache Hadoop, Amazon Web Services and/or ideally use of Google Big Query and Google Cloud Platform (preferred); - Use of NoSQL technologies like MongoDB or Graph Databases (e.g. Neo4J) WHAT WE BRING - Permanent contract - Has the option to work from home under the condition of company rules - Good working atmosphere - Extra commission system Job Type: Full-time Salary: 25,000.00€ - 40,000.00€ per year Application Question(s): Do you live in Spain or do you have the necessary documentation to work in Spain? Language: English (Required) Work Location: In person

Company Description  Launched in 1998, this pioneering British-born brand has specialised in creating amazing experiences and unforgettable memories - from hotels, city breaks and holidays to theatre, entertainment and spa days. Experts in brightening up online travel, lastminute.com is among the worldwide leaders in the field, helping hundreds of thousands of customers every year find, and do, "whatever makes them pink". lastminute.com is the European Travel-Tech leader in the dynamic holiday packages business, uniquely positioned to drive innovation-led growth. Every month, lastminute.com reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services At the heart of our culture is a commitment of inclusion across race, gender, age sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.  Job Description  We are looking for a highly qualified and motivated Machine Learning Scientist to work with learn to rank and recommendation problems. The selected candidate will be part of a cross-functional team composed of machine learning scientists, data scientists, and machine learning engineers. Key Responsibilities Develop complex analysis putting together different sources of data to identify patterns and anomalies Develop effective machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, machine learning engineers, and data scientists Effectively manage incidents and problems, identify root causes, and implement remediation actions.  Qualifications  Essential Excellent knowledge of Python and SQL At least 2 years of experience or a Ph. D. in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics Good knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) Good knowledge of Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction) Good knowledge of Reinforcement learning with a focus on multi armed bandit theory Knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis Experience with distributed version control systems Able to formalize a complex problem, prepare a plan, and clearly communicate the findings Bonus points if you have Experience with NoSQL databases  Additional Information  By joining our company, you will have the chance to: Join a dynamic team in an inclusive-international environment Grow thanks to the career journey and our internal mobility perspective Manage your own schedule thanks to the flexible start and end of the working day Work a shorter working week (36h), of which 4 hours on Friday morning Get focus time for learning, development, research, and deep work on Friday mornings Work partially or fully remote according to local laws Enjoy continuous training thanks to our company platform Benefit from employee discounts on travel Receive 2 days off per year for the purpose of volunteering Receive a bonus after 5 and one after 10 years in the company Get free snacks / fruit / hot drinks / water / beverages at our offices Participate in amazing winter and summer corporate events Benefit from extended parental or marriage leave

: CareerStart@sas Internship Program 2024  Nice to meet you!  We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence – and questions into answers.  We’re also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to IPO-readiness. If you’re looking for a dynamic, fulfilling internship coupled with flexibility and world-class employee experience, you’ll find it here.  Opportunity  Within our EMEA/ APAC-wide Internship Program CareerStart@sas we’re offering a 6-month full-time internship in our Pre sales department as Data Science Intern.  A great opportunity to work on the most innovative analytics solutions and projects in an international environment as a part of the Pre-Sales Support team: The best collaborators of the sales people, always ready to discover, study and learn something more and innovative in Solutions, Technical and customer domain. The presentation’s gurus; they create pilot and proof of concept to demonstrate how SAS Solution can solve business problems and reach customer needs. As a Data Scientist Intern, you will: Support the analytics team in demo and PoCs/PoVs preparations Working together with analytics team in answering RFI’s and RFPs Involvement and Participation in all analytics team meetings  Required qualifications: You’re curious, passionate, authentic, and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do. Strong communication skills – both written and verbal. We’re a global company, English is a key. Leadership abilities. Your past experiences demonstrate you’ll take initiative and go above and beyond the call of duty. You’re interested in the future of Analytics and embrace technology. You’re a college student enrolled in an accredited program at the end of course. Or, you are a fresh graduate. Target majors include all the STEM faculties: Business Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering.  Preferred qualifications Basic knowledge of Python, R, SQL, SAS is preferred. Will be an asset if you have any knowledge in Artificial intelligence or Machine Learning.  What you can expect? We’re not about coffee runs or boring busywork. Our internship program is focused on development, culture and community. We’ll help you grow professionally, thrive in an award-winning work environment and make memorable connections with your co-workers and fellow interns. We provide you with a unique business project and great opportunity to work on the most innovative analytics solutions during your internship. Besides that, you will have a SAS mentor, a personalized training program, and a tutor who always supports and enables you.  Perks of the job Work with (and learn from) the best. As a SAS intern, you’ll get face time with our top executives! Free SAS programming training and certification for technical consulting roles. At SAS, flexible work is the norm. Want to work remotely? That’s cool. Prefer a hybrid mix of sweatpants and in-person collaboration? That’s great, too. Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage. Your well-being matters, and that’s why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you stay healthy and productive.  Diverse and inclusive At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.  Additional Information  Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.  All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning. We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That's why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries. Meet the team!  At Preply, we are continually enhancing the experience for both learners and tutors. To do this even more effectively, we've created a new cross-functional product squad!  On one hand, we're here to empower our tutors, assisting them in delivering top-notch tutoring that enhances student retention and overall learning value.  On the other hand, we aim to empower learners to keep the flame of learning alive even outside scheduled lessons. Our approach integrates lesson content into self-learning, ensuring tutors stay informed about student progress. Your primary responsibility will involve facilitating how we incorporate AI into the company. Selecting the most suitable ML modeling and generative AI tools for each specific problem and overseeing their integration within the product. What you'll be doing: Stay ahead of AI trends and contribute to shaping the future of AI-assisted tutoring and AI-driven learning in collaboration with our cross-functional product squad. Identifying user needs and leveraging third-party AI solutions to enhance the learning experience for both learners and tutors. Writing production code and developing pipelines when needed. Evaluate the quality of technical solutions in the area of AI/ML. Partner with the squad's Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations. Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap. Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences. Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale. Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators. Effectively communicating your findings to technical and non-technical audiences. Support the technical growth of data scientists in your team or area of speciality. Leading the way in how we use AI throughout our product team. What you need to succeed: Extensive experience in product data analytics and at least 3 years of previous experience as a Data Scientist. Understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI. Good and broad understanding of data analysis concepts such as (but not limited to) conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc. Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field. Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.). Experience and/or interest in extracting insights, identifying patterns, and uncovering trends from large datasets. Exhibiting strong curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to identify and address underlying problems. Emphasizing a creative mindset and proactively engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses. Possessing strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Nice to have: Experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C). Experience with NLP and Voice Recognition field. Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions. Experience in the areas of recommender systems. Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field. Have mentored others before. Why you'll love it at Preply: An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture; A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development; A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance; Access to free mental health support platforms; Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health; The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our Principles: Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing. We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience. Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters. Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen. Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently. Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions. Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks. Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference. Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don't fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made. One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.  #LI-VS1

Do you want to get involved and become part of a dynamic company and have the opportunity to innovate with your work and skills? We are seeking a highly motivated junior data scientist to join our team the Customer Value Management team, based in Barcelona, interested in enriching a crossfunctional team and the development of new technologies/tools related to it. This area of De Agostini is focused on the development, implementation, measurement, and continuous improvement of processes, analysis, and in future advanced algorithms. Its objective is the optimization of key business metrics such as churn, customer satisfaction, as well as their recurrence and profitability, among others. Our focus is on our D2C customers, our relationship with them, customers’ behaviour and activity, and the data we have on all their touchpoints and activities. What you will do: Specially on first months, you will be actively contributing on the data quality verification (raw and calculated data) being fed to the data lake (BigQuery). Perform data analysis with a focus on quality, ensuring accuracy and reliability of data. Create, improve, and maintain dashboards to visualize and present data insights and/or new KPIs. Participate in the activation process of use cases with a new CDP (Customer Data Platform) and other marketing tools. Engage in technical discussions and participate in brainstorming sessions with the teams to translate business problems into technical solutions. In a second stage: You will be analysing large datasets and applying machine learning methodologies using Python and/or R. Employ ML solutions to address issues related to prioritization, recommendation, and personalization in various areas of customer engagement: loyalty, product / service enhancement, and customer support. This aims to enhance the customer experience and optimize efforts in marketing, sales, and product.  MSc/MA or higher degree in information technology, data science, statistics, engineering, mathematics, or related subjects (completed or ongoing) 2-3 years’ experience previous as data scientist Previous experience with BigQuery Previous experience with Looker Studio and/or Qlik Sense and/or PowerBI Coding skills in Python Experience with the extraction, organization, and analysis of unstructured information Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proficiency in presenting findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through written reports and oral presentations. C1 (Advanced) level of English. What we offer: Stable Contract: Permanent and Full-time. You will have the opportunity to develop professionally through our internal training and talent development plans. Exclusive discounts and promotions for our employees (master's and postgraduate programs, editorial imprints, collectibles, Casa del Libro, etc.). An attractive package of social benefits through the flexible compensation plan, including: transportation card, restaurant card, childcare voucher, health insurance, etc. One day of remote work This position offers the opportunity to work in a collaborative and challenging environment, where your skills in data analysis will be fundamental to the ongoing success of our organization.

Job Title Data Scientist Summary As a Games Data Scientists you are business facing mastermind who helps turn business questions into actionable insights. You research and analyse player behaviour, and come up with recommendations. You do this by listening to stakeholders, understanding context and challenging business ideas.  You will use diverse Data Science techniques - frequentist and Bayesian statistics, machine learning, exploratory and explanatory data analysis, causal inference, data visualization, monte carlo modelling, econometric analysis, etc.  The data science department at Product Madness is made up of over 20 employees based across the globe. With a range of experience, there is also somebody to learn new skills from and develop your career. An award winning team, we push the boundaries of data science and encourage new ways of thinking. What You'll Do Discuss with stakeholders requirements for analysis Run exploratory data analysis and turn it into questions which can be answered with analytical techniques Proactively identify areas of improvement, run analysis, modelling to shape recommendations Communicate/present your results to key stakeholders Answer questions and tackle business problems utilising statistical or casual interference Collaborate, learn and share ideas & skills with the wider Data Science team As well as endless learning opportunities and the ability to progress your career you will be well rewarded for your work, below is just some of our amazing benefits: Outstanding basic salary 25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off Flexibility of 1 hours at the start and end of the working day + Summer working hours Fully hybrid working arrangements 50€ Amazon voucher for your birthday Yearly Bonus Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees. GYMPASS - free gym membership Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period) What We're Looking For Visualisation techniques for present data analysis Python or R Experience Intermediate to advanced SQL Background in using data science to solve business problems Degree in relevant background - Mathematics, economics, statistics Any experience with AB Testing would be beneficial Why Product Madness? You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United. Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel. You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.  So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness? Our Values People First We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed. MAD for More Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company. Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos. Globally Inclusive We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact. Customer Focused We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers. Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

380849BR Data Scientist Spain About the role The Barcelona Digital Finance hub is a start-up within Novartis, which crafts finance business partnering solutions demonstrating innovation and talent. Artificial intelligence and predictive analytics are reshaping the function and this new team will be a differentiator, encouraging new ideas. To add even greater value for the business we need to have the right people with the right capacities in the right location. We need ground-breaking innovation, customer-orientation and focus on bringing the best services and solutions to the business – both globally and locally – to support Finance. We are looking for early talent with experience in consulting or business partnering who are eager to make a difference.  The hub offers a real opportunity to develop in a highly fast-paced, multicultural, technology-driven environment where collaboration and innovation are at the heart of who we are and what we do.  Your responsibilities include, but not limited to:  Translate business questions into analytical problems and build solutions using visualization techniques, machine and deep learning, and statistical modeling Search and develop new algorithms, methods, statistical models and business models, providing insight into structured and unstructured data. Quickly learn and pilots the use of tools, data sources and analytical techniques needed to answer a wide range of critical business questions and to improve status quo Identify research articles and reproduce/apply innovative methodology to Novartis business problems Provide understandable and meaningful business intelligence for key partners Bring understanding of one or more areas of data sciences and is able to demonstrate practical knowledge of techniques Help developing new quantitative methods with the aim of improving processes in various projects and developing new analysis opportunities by integrating existing and new data sources Support various projects, of limited scope. Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve. Role Requirements Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or in a quantitative field Academic experience in a multidisciplinary data & analytics environment or in research Experience in predictive modelling and large data analysis Experience in statistical/analytics tools such as R, SAS, Python or big data technologies for machine learning Expertise in at least a visualization tools QlikView, Spotfire, Tableau for crafting insights. A track record of innovating through machine learning, data bases and statistical algorithms and their applications. Hands on experience with data mining, its concepts, techniques and implementation. Fluent English (written and verbal) Desirable requirements: Business proficient in Spanish (written and spoken)  Why consider Novartis?  799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?  We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.  Imagine what you could do at Novartis!  Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here:  https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network Division Finance Business Unit Global Finance Work Location Barcelona Gran Vía Company/Legal Entity Novartis Farmacéutica, S.A. Functional Area Audit & Finance Job Type Full Time Employment Type Regular Shift Work No Early Talent Yes

En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres. Buscamos un/a STAGER DATA SCIENTIST ¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA? Como Data Scientist, formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail. Desarrollarás soluciones punteras de ciencia de datos y aprendizaje automático para habilitar casos de uso muy innovadores en el sector retail, como geoanalítica, robotización, personalización omnicanal, la tienda omnicanal, consumidor 360º y decisiones en tiempo real. ¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO? Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales. Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos. Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecha las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción. Trabajarás con AWS services como S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, etc. Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería en un equipo formado por Data Scientist, Data Engineers, Data Architects y desarrolladores full stack. ¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI? Que estés estudiando un Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas o Estadística o Ciencia de Datos con buenos resultados académicos. Que tengas conocimiento sobre Data Modelling y SQL. Tengas capacidad para programar (o facilidad de aprendizaje) en Python, R o Scala. ¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES? Formarás parte de una empresa internacional en plena transformación tecnológica, como parte del equipo de Data & Advanced Analytics de Mango. 6 meses de prácticas (remuneradas). Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales. Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%. ¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES? Incorporación a través de un convenio de prácticas con tu universidad Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes compatible con tus estudios Posibilidad de teletrabajo Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès Beneficios sociales y otros descuentos Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso. You got it? We like you!

About Arbolus Arbolus is reinventing the traditional and analog expert network industry by bringing technology to the forefront of knowledge sharing. Our platform helps hundreds of clients worldwide to connect with the best experts, collect high-quality insights faster, and streamline their processes using leading AI technology.  Headquartered in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up working with global consulting and leading private equity firms. With offices in Barcelona, New York, and Gurgaon, we have a truly international team of over 150 people. Recently listed as one of Europe’s top 25 fastest-growing companies, we are building a team that can continue to support our ambitious growth plans.  About the role You will be a creator of data visualization dashboards and looking over extracting data insights to identify strategic opportunities. You will also leverage advanced statistics and machine learning techniques to undercover data patterns and create machine learning models.  Key responsibilities you will be in charge of  Proactively investigate and analyze business trends to find actionable insights Support the company by creating dashboards and enabling data-driven decision-making. Collect, clean, and merge data to validate hypotheses & designs Create and maintain Machine Learning models About you We are looking for an ambitious individual with great business and technical skills, and the ability to analyze different sources of information, create visualizations, and explain their findings to the stakeholders.  Requirements to succeed in this role Bachelor's degree in computer science, maths engineering, or a quantitative field 2+ years experience in a data scientist role Knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases Experience with business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio, or similar) Experience with Python or R and Machine Learning libraries (Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Keras, PyTorch, etc.) The ability to effectively communicate your analyses to business and technical audiences Excellent verbal and written English communication skills Self-driven, agile, and able to work independently and on multiple engagements simultaneously Nice to have Proficient with Excel or Google Spreadsheets Basic understanding of SQL pipelines (DBT) and other software development tools, such as git Experience with HuggingFace and other Machine Learning tools Experience applying a wide range of statistical techniques to data sets, and understanding their real-world advantages/drawbacks  What we offer Annual performance bonus on top of your base salary 25 days of paid time off per year + all local bank holidays. Arbolus puts heavy emphasis on quality of life and wants to ensure everyone has a fair amount of time to recharge and relax Flexibility with local bank holidays Share option plan for all employees Private health insurance Flexible remuneration for meals and transport (Cobee Card) Relocation package to help you with your move to Barcelona 2 weeks per year to work from abroad Top-notch equipment to make our work efficient and smooth (MacBook Air, Jabra 75 headphones set,...) Free coffee, tea, and snacks to boost our energy during the day Monday office breakfast to start our week Regular social activities are managed by our local Social Committees Language courses to extend our knowledge (English, Spanish, and Catalan) Office First organization  Arbolus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Please be advised that at this moment Arbolus is not able to provide support in the visa sponsorship process.

titulo: Investigador/a Inteligencia Artificial Optimización - Data Scientist / AI Researcher
descripcion: EURECAT Eurecat es el principal centro tecnológico de Cataluña y la segunda organización de investigación privada más grande del sur de Europa. Aglutina la experiencia de más de 700 profesionales y presta servicio a cerca de 2.000 empresas. I+D aplicado, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica o valorización y explotación de la propiedad industrial son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El centro tecnológico participa en más de 200 grandes proyectos consorciados de I+D+i nacionales e internacionales de alto valor estratégico y cuenta con 181 patentes y 10 spin-off. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa.  Descripción de la oferta La Unidad de Applied Artificial Intelligence de Eurecat desarrolla soluciones innovadoras (algoritmos, métodos, plataformas) basadas en la combinación de tecnologías de inteligencia artificial y gestión del conocimiento, especialmente orientadas al sector industrial, recursos (agua y energético), medioambiental y cambio climático, agroalimentario, aeroespacial y/o construcción.  INVESTIGADOR/A INTELIGENCIA ARTIFICIAL OPTIMIZACIÓN / DATA SCIENTIST FUNCIONES: Participar en la ejecución de proyectos, centrados en la transferencia tecnológica y la aplicación de arquitecturas y plataformas, para resolver retos concretos de diversos sectores: industrial, recursos (agua y energético), medioambiental y cambio climático, agroalimentario, aeroespacial y/o construcción Investigación y diseño de optimizadores mediante metodologías novedosas Definición de problemas de optimización, restricciones, funciones de coste entre otros, juntamente con expertos de dominio para dar respuesta a retos tecnológicos Aplicación de métodos estadísticos, algoritmos de búsqueda exactos, heurísticas y metaheurísticas para la resolución de problemas de optimización combinatoria en la planificación de recursos, optimización de procesos y toma de decisiones Desarrollo de documentación básica relacionada con las tareas en las que intervienen Redacción de propuestas I+D competitivas Participar en congresos, jornadas o diferentes actividades relacionadas con los proyectos desarrollados en el área, de ámbito regional o europeo Requisitos FORMACIÓN:  Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Física, Estadística o similares Deseable estudios o especialización (máster, postgrado, PhD) en IA, Optimización o Estadística. Muy valorable formación o experiencia en plataformas de servicios software, arquitecturas de datos, Data Science y / o tecnologías semánticas.  EXPERIENCIA Y CONOCIMIENTOS: Valorable experiencia académica o profesional en proyectos de I+D, en el ámbito industrial, gestión de recursos (energía/agua), medioambiental y cambio climático, agroalimentario, aeroespacial y/o construcción Experiencia en el desarrollo de algoritmos de optimización, y en concreto optimización combinatoria, para la gestión de recursos, planificaciones, rutas, diseño, operaciones, procesos, … Experiencia en formalización de problemas de optimización: definición de la función a optimizar y el espacio de búsqueda con restricciones. Experiencia en alguna de las siguientes herramientas: Java (librerías como OptaPlanner), Python (librerías como Hyperopt), R Valorable conocimiento en optimización bayesiana, procesos estocásticos y en modelos de grafos probabilísticos Deseable experiencia en alguno de estos ámbitos: Experiencia en gestión y / o participación en proyectos con consorcios transnacionales Experiencia en ámbitos de I + D + i colaborativos y documentación de proyectos europeos. Capaz de desarrollar y desplegar de forma independiente prototipos de soluciones de analítica y gestión de datos para los problemas identificados Experiencia en metodologías y estrategias para DoE Capacidad analítica y critica para evaluar resultados Autonomía para afrontar nuevos retos y problemas, búsqueda de soluciones, diseño de pipelines de análisis de forma  Posición: Investigador/a Departamento: Applied Artificial Intelligence Tipo de Contrato: Indefinido Jornada laboral: Jornada completa Sector: Internet y tecnología Vacantes: 1 Disciplina: I+D Modalidad de trabajo: Híbrida

Descripción de la empresa  ¿Te consideras una persona con un growth mindset? ¿Te apetece empezar un proyecto en el que aprenderás cosas nuevas cada día? ¿Te apetece trabajar con expertos en agilidad llevando a cabo proyectos en empresas líderes en su sector que llevan la innovación en su ADN? ¡Sigue leyendo!    Descripción del empleo  Tu principal objetivo será acompañar el desarrollo de la estrategia de nuestro cliente en cuanto al uso de los datos y la creación de una cultura data-driven mediante la creación y la correcta implantación de diferentes programas formativos en el ámbito de Data. ¿Cuál es nuestra propuesta de valor para tí? Formarás parte de una empresa del grupo BTS en importante fase de crecimiento y en expansión internacional. Trabajarás en el proyecto con un equipo altamente cualificado, comprometido y motivado. Participarás en la estrategia de Transformación Digital y Agile de una importante multinacional con alto componente técnico. Disfrutarás de 23 días de vacaciones al año. Flexibilidad horaria. Posibilidad de realizar una colaboración como freelance. Posibilidad de llevar a cabo el proyecto 100% en remoto.  Velamos por tu desarrollo: Plan de carrera. Plan de formación individualizado.  Te damos apoyo para que te formes: Tendrás acceso al programa Grow Your Talent: 25 días laborables al año que podrás dedicar a realizar formaciones y acudir a eventos. Presupuesto anual para que inviertas en tu propia formación Acceso gratuito a todas las formaciones de Netmind incluyendo certificaciones (Project Management, Agile, Gestión del Cambio, Transformación Cultural, Coaching... y la posibilidad de obtener certificaciones oficiales de Scrum.org, IC Agile, Lean Kanban University, PMI,... entre muchas otras.)  Requisitos  ¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir para encajar en la posición? Que hayas estudiado Ciencias de la Información, Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otros campos relacionados. Que tengas al menos 2 años de experiencia consolidada como Data Scientist. Experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos matemáticos y algoritmos predictivos (machine learning ,modelos supervisados y no supervisados, agrupamiento, …) Experiencia trabajando con R y/o Python Capacidad y motivación para el diseño e impartición de formaciones, tanto en un formato síncrono como elearning (estarás trabajando entre el área de data y formación). Habilidades interpersonales con capacidad para establecer relaciones y colaborar eficazmente con diferentes equipos. Actitud empática, inclusiva y curiosa Muy deseable tener la capacidad de comunicarse eficazmente en inglés de forma verbal y escrita.  Información adicional  ¿Cómo va a ser el proceso de selección? 1a fase: Reunión de 45 minutos presencial o por videollamada con el departamento de people para que nos conozcas de una forma más detallada, explicarte el proyecto y que nos compartas tus opiniones, motivaciones y expectativas. 2a fase: 1 hora con la persona responsable del proyecto, para conocer el plan de acción planteado en el proyecto y concretar cómo será tu día a día y tus responsabilidades. 3a fase: 1 hora con el equipo que está trabajando dentro del proyecto para que os podáis conocer, ver el encaje y que puedas preguntar todo lo que se haya quedado en el tintero (¡y más!)  En resumen, si quieres trabajar en una compañía con presencia internacional y una de las referentes en agilidad, con un equipo de personas extraordinarias de las que podrás aprender cada día además de tener un plan de carrera a medida para que nunca pares de crecer, ¡Inscríbete ahora!

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM: TKWW is looking for a full-time Data Scientist to join our team of data professionals supporting our Marketplace Zone. The Data Scientist will partner with cross-functional teams to make strategic decisions, explore the state of our product, and find opportunities for improvement by analyzing data and developing analytical tools. They’ll work with product managers to design experiments and ensure we are making changes that drive measurable results. They will be a valued partner and trusted advisor. RESPONSIBILITIES: Gather, analyze, and interpret data to deliver business impact and help the organization make informed decisions Use descriptive statistical and modeling techniques like hypothesis testing, regression, classification, and clustering to augment data analyses and insights Forecast and simulate hypotheticals to deliver early potential signals before large initiatives start Design & analyze A/B testing experiments Build out self-serve reports, capabilities, and applications for partners within the organization Maintain a deep understanding of the product, relevant data products, and past experiments and analyses Recognize opportunities for new data products and integrations and work with business partners to implement them Work with engineers to ensure appropriate tracking is in place Communicate, collaborate, and present results to partners within TKWW SUCCESSFUL DATA SCIENTIST HAVE: Excellent communication skills; able to translate technical concepts to non-technical audiences Strong business acumen skills and ability to translate business problems into analytical solutions Foundational knowledge of statistics including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and forecasting Hands-on experience with A/B testing experiment design and analysis Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability to write efficient SQL code Ability to code in Python for data manipulation, visualization, and analysis using Jupyter notebooks Basic knowledge of dimensional modeling Fluent in English Master's or Ph.D. preferred 2-3 years of experience BENEFITS & PERKS: Private Health Insurance paid by the Company Subsidies and grants in training and English courses Working 100% from home Flexible working hours Tax relief options for Ticket Restaurant, Ticket Transportation, and Daycare Tickets restaurant Udemy courses Life insurance Gym discounts TYPS: easy APP to ask for salary advance payments in 48h Free paid hours: use your paid holidays as hours Referral bonus Getting married or having a baby? We have a gift for you!

¿Te interesa la analítica predictiva avanzada y la IA?  ¿Quieres formar parte de una empresa de consultoría consolidada en el ámbito nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional? ¿Te interesa proyectos innovadores relacionados con AI, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital? Si la respuesta es sí, entonces Innova-tsn podría ajustarse a lo que buscas.  En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar Consultores que tengan al menos 2 años de experiencia como Data Scientist para formar parte del área de AI Solutions and Strategy, realizando proyectos para diferentes sectores de la industria como el energético, bancario, retail u otros, desarrollando modelos en diferentes entornos On-premise y Cloud y utilizando herramientas AutoML.  Rol: Data Scientist  ¿Qué buscamos? Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 2 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos. Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva. Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest....) y técnicas de Forecasting. Conocimiento avanzado de alguno de estos lenguajes: Python, R, SAS, PySpark. Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas...  ¿Qué valoramos? Conocimiento en Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow. Conocimiento y/o experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización. Conocimiento en MLOps. Experiencia en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos. Capacidad de trabajar en equipo. Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial. Inglés.  ¿Qué ofrecemos nosotros? Contrato indefinido. Planes de carrera personalizados basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales. Beneficios sociales: seguro médico. Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant. Política de teletrabajo. Formación y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa. Formar parte de un equipo de consultoría especializado.  Para nosotros es importante fomentar el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los profesionales que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.  Si estás buscando un lugar donde desarrollar tu carrera profesional, ¡Ven a Innovar con nosotros! descripcion: We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world. Job Details Worldpanel by Kantar is the global expert in shopper behavior, offering continuous monitoring, advanced analytics and tailored solutions to inspire successful decisions by leading organizations worldwide. Worldpanel turns purchase behavior into a competitive advantage across a diverse range of markets including tech, fashion, telecoms and FMCG. ROLE’S MISSION We’re currently looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our Data Science team and answer client question through analytical techniques. You’ll work closely to both the commercial team and the operations and global Data Science teams. Our ideal candidate should have a passion for discovering patterns from large data sets and will work with internal and external stakeholders to understand and solve the business problems. If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary by joining us! KEY OUTCOMES: End to end production of the technical analysis in advanced analytics solutions. Support and develop new solutions collaborating with the Global Innovation Team to provide our clients the best answer for their business question. Explain processes and results to clients and internal teams regardless of the technical background of the audience. KEY CAPABILITIES: Your background will ideally look like this: University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Computer Science, Mathematics / Statistics, Engineering or equivalent quantitative fields. 3 to 4 years of confirmed experience in similar roles – Marketing Research experience would be a plus. Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis and visualization using R. Experience working with, and understanding of the detail behind relevant modelling techniques like clustering techniques, GLMs, decision trees, etc. Business proficiency in Spanish (C2) and English (C1 Level Minimum required) With the following qualities: With critical thinking and genuine passion for consumer behavior. Proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives. Highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within technical and non-technical environments. Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.  Permanent contract. The position can be based in our offices in Sant Cugat del Vallès (Bcn) or Madrid. Hybrid office/remote. Country Spain Why join Kantar? We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world. And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.
ubicacion: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Barcelona provincia

descripcion: Company Description  Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.  We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities: CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations. DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects. CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions. SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization. Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient. We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!  Job Description  Responsabilities: Statistical Analysis Data Manipulation and Cleansing Machine Learning Programming and Data Visualization Domain Knowledge in Banking Big Data Technologies Natural Language Processing (NLP) Collaborative and Communication Skills These skills, combined with experience and a passion for the banking sector, could empower a data scientist to make valuable contributions to our SCIB data scientist team.  Requirements> Python: Advanced Data Analytics: Intermediate Jupyter: Advanced NLP NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING: Intermediate (Plus)  Additional Information  What do we offer you? Permanent, full-time contract Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home. Training and career development Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, lunch pass cards Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects Hibrid position based Malaga, Spain Possibility to manage work permits.

We are seeking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Product Development team at Aimsun headquarters in central Barcelona. The candidate will work on developing our portfolio of data-driven solutions like Aimsun Live, our real-time decision support software. Reporting to the Global Head of Product Development, you will be part of a multidisciplinary team, working on a variety of studies involving mobility patterns and transportation systems.  Responsibilities: Developing new methods, algorithms and tools for the analysis and prediction of mobility data Combining data-driven and simulation-based models to study mobility and its management Suggest and implement improvements on current products Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization Help maintain data quality and organization Focus on performance and quality Must-Haves: MSc/PhD in a relevant field, such as engineering, mathematics or physics Python Experience with data science python packages such as numpy, scikit-learn, pandas Strong background in data analysis and machine learning Strong algorithmic, programming and computational problem-solving skills Full professional competence in written and spoken English Service orientation, flexibility, a positive attitude and team spirit Ability to work autonomously, proactively and thoroughly Strong analytical / problem solving skills European citizen or Spanish work permit Nice-to-Haves: Fluency in Spanish Over two years of experience in a similar position Experience in SQL or timeseries databases Experience in deep learning with tensorflow or pyTorch Optimization and operational research Data visualization Computational simulation tools Additional languages if spoken and written natively or fluently

Barcelona Headquarters  Hello! We are Volotea, the airline of the small and mid-sized cities in Europe. Since our inception in 2012, we have been amongst the fastest-growing low-cost airlines in Europe. We are enthusiastic enablers of direct travel for Europeans who don’t live in big hubs. We are changing air travel from small and mid-sized cities in Europe, many previously unconnected or underserviced. We aim to connect the people in these cities with their passion for travel, in an enjoyable and increasingly sustainable way. After over a decade in the skies, we have now flown more than 55 million passengers. Today, we serve over 100 destinations in 18 countries, actively consolidating our position among the top European airlines in the industry. In recent years, we have raised our travel capacity more than most competitors, increasing our number of aircraft, routes, destinations, employees, and markets. Throughout this journey, our team continues to excel and grow stronger as our services gain recognition amongst an expanding European audience. We are a young, dynamic, and international team that enjoys working together to grow our company during this exciting time in the airline industry. If you feel inspired by our story and you’re ready to take off with us, continue reading! Our main markets are France, Italy, Spain, and Greece. We have 19 operational bases: Nantes, Bordeaux, Toulouse, Marseille, Strasbourg, Lille, Lourdes, and Lyon in France; Venice, Verona, Palermo, Cagliari, Olbia, Florence, and Naples in Italy; Asturias and Bilbao in Spain; Athens in Greece, and Hamburg in Germany. We are hiring a Data Scientist who has experience in interacting with different cultural environments and can work in a challenging high-growth atmosphere. Are you a skilled, positive, assertive, and sociable individual who enjoys working as part of a multicultural team? If your answer is yes, apply to come on board and make Volotea your next professional destination. What you will do: Combine independent problem-solving tasks with proactive integration in a highly dynamic team. Play with different data sources to identify, define and develop new process optimization strategies. Maintain, update and improve existing algorithms and machine learning models. Explore current industry trends and recent academic research to update and enhance the in-house workflows. What you will need: Degree in analytical field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or other technical field). At least one year of experience in data mining, software development, statistics or machine learning. Strong programming skills with Python. Knowledge of SQL. Experience in software design, testing and cloud platforms. Ability to think analytically, quantitatively, and creatively. Good Communications skills. Advanced level of Spanish and English. What do we offer: Flexible vacation days. Flexibility to work from home up to two days per week and subject to manager's approval. Access to year-round free flights (exc. airports tax) for you, your partner, and your children, with over 100 airlines worldwide. Gym pass discounts and more. Continuous training to continue your development.  Learn more about working at Volotea HQ. Watch our colleagues define it in one word. Volotea is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit diverse candidates. Our goal is to continuously improve and sustain an inclusive culture by attracting, developing, and engaging the best talent in our industry.  Data Privacy Please read our Data Privacy Policy here.
