Solution Architect Our client is looking for a highly motivated, passionate and innovative technologist to join their team as a Solution Architect within their Telecoms practice. The successful candidate will be responsible for the end to end architecture and technical delivery of Big Data and analytics solutions delivered to mobile and fixed line telecoms clients, delivered using their best-in-class products The company They are a dynamic and exciting company that started up 5 years ago. They have some of the largest names in Telecoms as their clients and they continue to innovate with their products - not only to keep them ahead of their competition but to create industry best and technology direction, as well as thought leadership. They specialise and are a leader in Big Data, Analytics, and Machine Learning, with award-winning solutions that transform their clients' operations. The company continues to grow, and this role represents an excellent opportunity to join a successful and ambitious team that strives to over achieve. About You You will need to be a self starter, committed to delivering high quality solutions to their demanding customers, dealing with a range of technical and commercial stakeholders and a technology obsessive - keeping abreast of and evaluating relevant new technologies. It goes without saying that great interpersonal, written and oral communication skills are a must. The A willingness to take ownership of solutions, issues and see them through to conclusion is required. The successful candidate will possess the following skills: Essential Batchelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related/equivalent At least 10 years’ experience in a technical solution/architect role with exposure to telco and analytics, in both vendor/operator environments Solid knowledge and experience of ETL, Data Integration and Data Warehousing concepts Demonstrable experience of leading and delivering large complex projects covering a range of technologies, domains and functions Experience of developing and maintaining architectural and design documentation (HLD, LLD, etc) Extensive experience of requirements analysis and development of these into technical solutions Knowledge of telecoms signalling protocols covering mobile RAN, Packet/Voice Core Strong analytical capabilities Linux experience A creative and analytical approach to problem solving Ability to work in a pressurised, fast passed and agile environment Highly desirable Knowledge of Telecoms Networks networks Solid knowledge of database systems and query tools KPI design and implementation Understanding of data science, machine learning and AI concepts Experience of delivering projects in on-Premise and Cloud environments Knowledge of containerisation technologies (eg Kubernetes, Docker) Knowledge of some or all of the following technologies – Hadoop, Kafka, MapReduce, Hive, Redis, MongoDB, Elastic Knowledge of RDBMS and NoSQL architectures and platforms Experience of data visualisation tools (eg Kibana, Tableau) TCP/P and networking knowledge Development experience (eg Python, Spark, Java, R, SQL etc) Please ignore the salary stated as it is negotiable.

Sony AI are seeking a proven Senior Research Scientist for Data Mining to join our newest team in Barcelona and work with our Gastronomy Flagship Project team. You should hold a PhD as well as a proven track record of running and delivering your own projects including either leading teams or securing grants for your research. You should also have industry lab experience and expertise in working with sizable data sets, extracting knowledge or rules from data, and ideally experience of applying ontologies to semantically enrich ML approaches. You should enjoy exploring the forefront of what is technologically possible, thrive in the face of the uncertainty and the experimental nature of working in a research environment, and find purpose in translating between novel research ideas and their application to challenging problems in a high-risk, high-reward setup. We offer the opportunity to join a responsible AI lab, where your manager will support you to make an impact and be recognised for your work. You’ll enjoy working with a diverse and international team in a flexible setting recognizing different personalities and lifestyles. Find out more here: https://ai.sony/projects/gastronomy/ , and if you’re ready to take on the challenge with us, we want to hear from you. You will: Devise and lead research developing novel, practically relevant approaches to data mining and knowledge discovery from large heterogeneous data sets. Investigate and implement (up to proof-of-concept stage) new algorithms and approaches to solving AI problems. Serve as company-wide reference for questions relating to data mining and knowledge discovery. Write code to support research, usually in Python. Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences. Write papers for and give presentations at academic conferences. Closely collaborate with colleagues in Spain, US, Japan and Switzerland You will bring: PhD in computer science (or equivalent in education and experience) with focus on AI/ML and significant engagement with questions of data mining and knowledge discovery. Several years of research experience after completion of the PhD. Experience developing and evaluating ML models. Experience with (applications of) data mining and knowledge discovery. Experience with the supervision of interns and/or mentoring of junior team members. Passion for making AI work in realistic domains. Experience programming in Python. Plus: Experience with Graph Neural Networks. Plus: Experience with NLP. Plus: Experience as a software engineer (or equivalent). Strong plus: Experience with ontologies and structured knowledge bases. Strong plus: Experience with the integration of structured knowledge and/or formal rules in ML systems. Strong plus: Experience working in industry/an applied R&D lab. Strong plus: Experience managing relationships with external collaborators. Key attributes: The ability and the willingness to work with research scientists in an ambitious research project with several unknowns, developing mutual understanding and a joint culture. The ability to deliver on tight deadlines and adapt to evolving or changing requirements. The ability and the willingness to work as a member of a distributed team spanning several time zones and bringing together people from diverse cultural and personal backgrounds. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, as well as interpersonal skills including the ability to articulate to both technical and non-technical audiences Plus: Japanese language skills. Your new office In our Barcelona office you can enjoy a modern and open working environment with unbeatable views of the city. Located in Avenida Diagonal, in an energy efficient building, it is very convenient to reach the office by public transport. You can enjoy your lunch or coffee in our office kitchen, on the terrace next to the lobby, or you can walk to one of the many restaurants and shopping centres nearby. Life at Sony We ensure competitive salaries and benefits by using established benchmarking. We encourage healthy work-life balance supported by hybrid and flexible working policies. We are a positive community who dream big together, respect each other, and enjoy a collaborative culture. We like to celebrate our colleagues who make a real difference using our recognition platform. We also provide access to numerous services and platforms for all aspects of wellbeing. We listen to our people through conversations and surveys, respect their suggestions, then act on them. We also provide allowances for volunteering days so that our staff can support the causes they are most passionate about. You can build your career around you with our fantastic range of learning & personal development programs to enhance your skills. We also encourage our staff to try exciting new roles, in a wide range of countries, with a supportive mobility team to support you if you take that leap! Bring your uniqueness to Sony We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture. We are Sony Europe. Our people collaborate in an environment of respect, integrity, and open-mindedness. Diverse teams from all over Europe are the driving force for our business, and we embrace the differences that make each of us original and unique. With offices in 28 European countries, Sony Europe caters to consumer, professional, semiconductor and healthcare markets with innovative electronics products and solutions. Our European laboratories research and develop new technologies and capabilities that contributes to the Sony Group and important issues on a planetary scale. Bring your passion, creativity and ambitions to Sony Europe. Apply now, and let’s create the future together. #LI-MC1

Description Description Celtarys Research (www.celtarys.com), a newly created startup based in Santiago de Compostela (Spain), which develops and commercializes fluorescence- based innovative chemical tools to improve drug discovery, is looking for a PhD with expertise in Medicinal Chemistry.  She/He will be responsible for the conceptualization, design and execution of internal development projects, funded projects and custom development of fluorescent probes through the application of Celtarys Technology. Requirements Requirements A PhD in Medicinal Chemistry with > 4 years’ experience as post doc.  Extensive and accreditated experience in:  Organic synthesis: full autonomy in design and realization of multipsteo synthesis (also more than 6-7 steps) for the obtention of complex molecular structure with specific restrictions in terms of stability (such as fluorophores, biomolecules derivatives, etc.); Strong and wide knowledge of biomolecules and small molecules purification and characterization approaches; Independent design of new molecules able to interact with specific targets of interest; Deep understanding of the biological data related to the compounds developed to incorporate them into new designs and/or potential refinement of molecular probes leading to successful experimental outcomes; Understanding of molecule/target interaction principles and modes; Knowledge of medicinal chemistry basis and approaches to modify molecules structures to improve their bioactivity; Strong independence, problem solving, troubleshooting skills and proven ability to lead research projects; Responsible and goal-oriented professional, able to integrate into a multidiciscplinary team and work in a competitive environment, dealing with multiple projects and client deadlines. Fluent in English Experience in the field of fluorescent probes development is a plus.
ubicacion: 15706 Santiago de Compostela, A Coruña provincia

descripcion: Data Science Team @Heetch LLMs, hyperparameter tuning, parallel computing? Let’s first get the buzzwords out of the way, at Heetch we care about maximizing the impact rather than hype. Our Data people main strength lies more in their capacity to proactively seek out stakeholders and build relationships with them Our team’s mission is to provide valuable data insights to Product/Marketing/Marketplace squads in order to help them understand what is going on, discover opportunities, and take impactful decisions that will later on improve the whole experience for both our drivers and passengers The position will be based either in our Barcelona office or remotely from Spain  What are the challenges Data Scientists face at Heetch? Navigate through thousands of different datasets Identify hidden business opportunities proactively Motivate and/or automate data-driven decision-making Improve our rules and processes around data quality standards Work in one of the most competitive industries with a challenger status  What will you do? Work alongside a Product team and become an expert in your domain’s data Collaborate and lead cross-teams data projects, with various stakeholders (product managers, developers, data engineers…) Dig into the product's performance with thorough analyses, to uncover hidden opportunities for growth and efficiency for Heetch Architect data models and pipelines, to transform raw data into product insights Design, monitor and analyse product experiments such as A/B tests, with frequentists and Bayesian methods Develop and present actionable business intelligence dashboards  Does it sound like you? You have 3+ years experience in data manipulation, and a strong knowledge of SQL and Python You create clear and powerful data visualisations (dashboards, presentations...) You can communicate effectively with colleagues from various backgrounds and technical levels You have statistical knowledge and know how to navigate the traps of experimentation (A/B testing) You proactively detect issues and identify their root cause, by asking the Five Whys You want to steer the company in the right direction in terms of data quality standards You are fluent in English (it’s the language we use within the company, because hey we’re an international team \uD83D\uDE42) If you have experience leading cross-team projects, it will be a plus  Our team's values Transparency: We discuss everything openly within the team. Our 'Speak up' culture is strong Learn from failures: It's ok to fail, learn from it and try again Experiment things: Being free is part of our DNA, we can try things as long as it brings value Caring is sharing: We believe in continuous learning and want you to be proud of what you've learned/built. Sharing is a natural part of the process What's next? If your application is selected, the process will be in 4 steps: Interview with a recruiter (45mn) Take home assignment (~1 week deadline) Assignment follow-up with your future manager (1h) A last round to meet your future teammates and key stakeholders  \uD83C\uDF08Heetch embraces diversity and equal opportunity for everyone \uD83C\uDF0D We provide a safe and inclusive work environment. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. For non-European citizens, a valid working visa for France is required to be eligible for the role.  Heetch SAS is collecting your personal data (identity, contact details, academic background, professional experience and optionally a covering letter) for the processing of your application to our job offer, based on your consent. Your personal data will only be accessible to our hiring team, our co-founders, and the manager of the position you are applying to. In addition, data are stored by our processor in order to use its applications tracking system. Your data may be stored outside of the EU/EEA but are protected by appropriated safeguards. Your data are stored for a maximum duration of two years. If we do not reply to your application, you allow us to store your data during this term in order to potentially contact you for another position within our company or affiliates and subsidiaries. You have a right to access to your data, to rectify them, under some conditions to erase them, and to limit the processing. Also, you have a right of portability on your data. In addition, you may revoke your consent and we shall stop processing your data. Eventually, you have a right to define directives about the fate of your data if your death should occur. For more information about your rights, please see our privacy policy.

Date: 4 Jan 2024 Location: SFEL - R&D SANT FELIU DE LLOBR, ES, ES - Spain Company: Almirall Mission As a Clinical Data Standards Lead you will elaborate data collection strategies and methods promoting the delivery of clinical data that are aligned with study protocols, Almirall standards specifications, industry standards (CDISC) and ensuring Standards Conformance Guidelines as per Regulatory Agencies during drug dossier submissions.   As a Clinical Data Standards Lead you will report to the Senior Leader Clinical Data Management. You will work closely with Clinical Statistics, Clinical Programming, Senior Clinical Data Scientist, and will interact with other functions, like Clinical Leaders, Study Managers and Safety, acting as consultant support for other areas like Global Medical Affairs or Pre-Clinical. Tasks & Responsibilities Standards Governance Plan creation and updating along the clinical development and according to Regulatory Agencies. Including SDTMs and ADaMs version control Provide clinical data collection expertise to support high-quality data deliverables. Lead Global Standards Governance SOP and Global Standards Forms Review and Ensure Protocols consistency with CDISC and Almirall data standards code list. Ensure SDTM and ADaM specifications are followed by the CRO. Ensure the clinical data collection and Clinical Data Systems are properly configured by CRO in collaboration with the Clinical Data Scientist and the rest of study teams. Guarantee the quality and consistency of clinical trial data standards across the portfolio of projects/trials. Support to Pharmacovigilance using the coding dictionaries last versions of medical terminology (MedDRA, WHO) Validate the final CDISC study package, SDTMs, ADaMs, Define, ADGR, SDGR, programing coding data sets to be included in the Dossier and to be delivered to the Regulatory Agencies (i.e. FDA) for drug approval. Update the standards and SOPs based on the latest Regulatory Agencies guidelines. Oversight the Programming of Data Standards in cooperation with Clinical Data Scientist Manager and Clinical Programming to ensure the quality and consistency of clinical trial data standards across the portfolio. Provide and maintain the CRF build guidance updated. Development and maintenance of CRF allowable modifications and guidance on its intended usage New Data Collection specifications development when a new project is initiated in early phase. Edit Check and Dynamic specifications development in collaboration with the Senior and Clinical Data Scientist Review CRF Completion Guidelines to ensure consistency development and maintenance. Education Bachelor degree in preferably in life science, computer science, or health care related discipline. Experience 3+ years’ work experience in clinical data management and include minimum 2 years in data standards Advanced knowledge and leading skills in clinical data standards Advanced programming skills (SAS, others) CDISC certification is desired and data terminology expertise Excellent communication and presentation skills Teamwork and good stakeholder management Values and competencies Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed. Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets. Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.
ubicacion: Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Barcelona provincia

titulo: Data & Analytics Product Owner (all genders) - Remote
descripcion: Work Your Magic with us!  Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you've got big plans - so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people's lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.  United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.  Your Role : Join us to contribute to our company priority of driving innovation through data & digital. You will be responsible for creating solutions that turn data into actionable insights in close collaboration with our business stakeholders. This will involve building a deep understanding of business processes and identifying opportunities to leverage data & analytics for improving customer engagement in the pharmaceutical industry. A focus area will be the use of generative AI solutions like ChatGPT. We have started working on several use cases already, and you will play a crucial role in driving our generative AI ambition forward. In addition, you will focus on predictive analytics and recommendation systems. In creating these solutions, you will be able to leverage an advanced analytics ecosystem build on modern AWS, Snowflake and Palantir Foundry cloud technology and become part of a team of highly skilled experts working on data ingestion, transformation and analysis.  You will collaborate closely with international business teams, the headquarter-based IT team and data & analytics developer teams located in Europe and India. You will be the single point of accountability for scoping, delivery and deployment of your data & analytics solutions.  Who you are : Master's degree in computer science, mathematics, business administration with a technical focus, or related subjects 6+ years of experience as a product owner, data & analytics expert or data scientist Experience in working with data & analytics solutions such as AWS, Snowflake or Palantir Foundry . Strong drive to identify new use cases that leverage data to improve business processes . Experience with Healthcare Marketing and Sales is a plus Excellent English communication skills and ability to effectively communicate both with business teams and developers Experience working in virtual teams What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!  Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Date: 12 Jan 2024 Location: SFEL - R&D SANT FELIU DE LLOBR, ES, ES - Spain Company: Almirall Mission Clinical Development Physician is an important part of Global Study Teams within Global Clinical Development. Provides medical input and support to the study team for a given clinical development project in line within defined clinical development strategy, Target Product Profile (TPP) and target labelling, in collaboration with the cross functional teams and under supervision of a Global Clinical Program Lead (GCPL) or a line manager. Serves as a primary source of clinical/medical accountability and oversight for the clinical study/ies. Tasks and Responsibilities Supports the GCPL and Clinical Development Scientist (CDS) in designing clinical development plans and clinical studies. Supports clinical study synopsis, study protocol, study protocol amendments elaboration in collaboration with GCPLs and CDS. Supports GCPL and CDS in review of the scientific content of the study protocol, amendments, CSRs, ICF, CRF, as well as scientific/clinical content of key internal or external project related documents (eg. IB, briefing package for regulatory authorities, ISE, ISS, publication). Provides medical support to the Clinical Study Team to address questions raised by Ethics Committees as well as questions coming form the investigators in preparation and during the study/ies conduct. Leads medical data review, including eligibility review and safety data review. Provides medical support for the protocol deviation review. Partners with CDS and Clinical Operations to support clinical study/ies delivery (enrollment status, eligibility criteria and adjudication for protocol violation, evaluate need for study protocol amendment/s) Once clinical study/ies results are available, support the GCPL and CDS in data analysis, data review and content proposals for the publications. Core member of the Clinical Study Team Education Medical degree. Experience 1-3 years of experience Industry experience in drug development is a plus Specific Knowledge Specialty in dermatology or immunology is a plus Fluency in English (written and spoken) Proficiency with MS Office. Values Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed. Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets. Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.
ubicacion: Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Barcelona provincia

titulo: Senior Product Manager - Technical, Discovery Tech, DiscoTec (Discovery Technology & Science)
descripcion: Bachelor's degree Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product Experience managing technical products or online services Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive-level prioritization and planning Experience in technical product management, program management or engineering Experience owning feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience with end to end product delivery Ability to communicate in written and spoken English Do you want to reach the next level in your career as a Technical Product Manager? Are you looking for new challenges and solving hard problems while using top-notch technologies? Join Discovery Technology team in Spain and you'll help millions of customers to discover the best from a multi-billion product selection!  Discovery Tech team helps customers discover and engage with new, popular and relevant products across Amazon worldwide. We do this by combining technology, science, innovation and creativity to build new customer-facing features and experiences alongside cutting edge tools for marketers. You will be responsible for creating products that help customers to shop cross-category, easily discover new ideas, new categories and new brands and have fun while shopping. Through leveraging machine-learning models, you will drive opportunities to automate Amazon’s cross-category marketing and merchandising and will help to deliver the best possible shopping experience for Amazon’s customers all over the globe.  A successful candidate will have a strong sense of ownership, great judgement, be highly analytical, able to work effectively in a matrixed organization, and adept at synthesizing a variety of technologies and capabilities into products that customers love. The ideal candidate for this role will be customer-obsessed with the capability to dive in and learn new technologies fast and who is comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment; will be a creative and an analytical problem solver.  Key job responsibilities You will lead, design, architect, and implement cutting-edge products and tools to be used by Amazon's marketers. You will play a key role in defining customer experience, roadmap and opportunities to scale, working closely with software engineers, applied scientists, UX research and design, business stakeholders and partner teams, and scaling learnings across the teams at Amazon.  A day in the life The duties will include working on the initial product definition, getting buy-in, and translating that vision into actionable, measurable experimentation and launch roadmap. You will develop and drive requirements back to engineering and applied science teams and partner with them to deliver exceptional products. Expect to be in charge of new projects and initiatives, developing new products, managing business and technical requirements, driving performance, and help building plans for the future. We need someone who is eager to grow with us and is passionate about driving clarity in highly ambiguous product and technical environments, and has a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.  About the team We believe in regular feature develop and frequent experimentation, allowing us to continuously improve the customer experience. You will have the opportunity to explore the many channels Amazon provides for customer outreach and engagement, both onsite and offsite. As a new team, we carry little tech debt. We prioritize writing high quality and maintainable code, and build systems that leverage existing tools to provide extensive test coverage across our services. The team provides a great opportunity to make an outsized impact in a burgeoning space and on fresh or even yet to be built services. There are few opportunities anywhere to start on a new team and make an immediate impact at this scale. Help us fulfil our mission of making Amazon the most loved shopping destination for each customer in the World!  Inclusive Team Culture Here at Amazon Discovery Technology, we embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We host frequent learning experiences to ensure DEI is consistently treated as a priority. We actively recruit people from diverse backgrounds to build a supportive and inclusive workplace, and take steps to ensure employees have a sense of belonging, value, and opportunity. Our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice. The perks of being an Amazon employee don't stop at collaborating with great people on exciting and innovative projects. Amazon’s benefits support the needs of our diverse workforce and their family members, no matter what stage they’re at in their life or career.  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Barcelona, B, ESP | Madrid, M, ESP  Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning. We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That's why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries. Meet the team: As a product team, our goal is to improve the life of our students and our tutors, drive amazing learning outcomes for our learners and enable our tutors to financially thrive through the platform. And we want to do this all while generating business value for Preply so we can help even more people! We strongly believe that we can't achieve business success without our students' and tutors' success. Preply is a product led company. As part of the product team, you will have a direct impact on the company's growth and strategy with high visibility to our C-suite and leadership team. You will be empowered to operate independently with a dedicated cross functional team to build amazing products and take them from inception to launch to scale! What you'll be doing: The ranking algorithm is a critical component of our edtech marketplace as it directly influences the quality of matches between language learners and tutors. It determines the relevance and personalization of the tutor suggestions provided to learners, thereby significantly impacting user satisfaction, engagement, and ultimately, the success of our learners, tutors and of the platform as a whole. As a Senior Product manager working on ranking, you will: Own the vision of our ranking algorithm:, You will own the vision for the ranking algorithm. This involves setting the strategic direction for how the algorithm will evolve to better serve the needs of our users. You will articulate this vision to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring everyone understands and is aligned with this vision. This includes defining the key objectives of the algorithm, making strategic decisions about its development, and guiding the team towards this vision through every stage of the product lifecycle. Be the voice of our customers and tutors: In a data product, it's easy to forget there are real humans searching for tutors. You will be expected to go deep, monitor and analyze user behavior data to understand user needs and preferences. Use these insights to refine the ranking algorithm and improve the overall user experience, ensuring learners find the most suitable tutors and vice versa. Be data driven: Analyze and make nuanced use of data, through our in-house tool, to truly understand how our users interact with our platform, and evaluate the business impact of new features and experiences Ensure Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other product teams, engineering, data science, marketing, and customer service teams to ensure the ranking algorithm aligns with broader product goals and strategies. Facilitate communication between these teams to ensure a unified approach to product development. Be a leader: Inspire the team with a vision and work cross-functionally to bring the product to life. Become an authority on your product area and identify areas of opportunity through deep customer insight, research, and data. You are able to lead a cross functional team, gathering the inputs and reconcile the different perspectives of Data Scientists and Engineers to align everyone under a common strategy. What this role is not: We are not looking for Pixel pusher / box mover / color changer. We expect the successful candidate to truly empathize with our users and to challenge the status quo to completely re-imagine the experience for our users. What you need to succeed: You have worked on data products leveraging machine learning, and are able to discuss algorithm at a deep enough level with the team You have experience working with data engineers and data scientists You possess strong analytical abilities and live and breathe data. You are a strong communicator, able to inspire and align your team and stakeholders to the end vision. You have substantial experience in product management You have experience building a product in a fast paced, and rapid growth environment. You possess the ability to support multiple initiatives at different phases of development. You deeply understand how your products work and how to measure long-term impact. You know every step of the funnel. You can design, run, and interpret experiments and A/B tests. You care about the users using your product, and value quantitative data. You're a natural leader. You know how to influence people to get things done across any job function. People love working with you. Why you'll love it at Preply: An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture; A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development; A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance; Access to free mental health support platforms; Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health; The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!). Our Principles Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing. We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience. Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters. Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen. Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently. Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions. Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks. Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference. Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don't fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made. One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

We are a high-growth Series-B InsurTech start-up using data and machine learning to revolutionize the insurance industry. You will be joining a strong and mission driven team, working to build a customer facing product that fundamentally changes the way insurers evaluate risk, enabling them to move from highly manual workflows to digital risk flows. Cytora’s Risk Stream is a serverless and cloud native SaaS platform that automates the digitisation, evaluation and decisioning of risks for commercial insurers. Our product drastically improves the working lives of our users, enables our customers to cover more risks, more competitively. The Role You will be helping to build Cytora’s Underwriting Productivity Suite, a serverless based web application that increases the efficiency and effectiveness of underwriters thereby reducing expense ratios and delivering profitable growth to our customers. Our team is multidisciplinary, composed of UX designers, Data Scientists, frontend/backend engineers, and product managers working together to build powerful solutions that allow our clients to integrate Cytora’s data and automation features into their insurance workflows. Along with core technical skills, we are excited about colleagues who bring passion for the craft of inventing and building products from the ground up. This means providing feedback to product managers and the wider company, contributing to roadmaps, and bringing your creativity to bear by suggesting features and improvements based on your technical understanding of what is possible and needed. As the technical face of our product, we are looking for someone who is customer-centric, values-driven, and collaborative with great communication skills. What working as a Senior Engineer at Cytora looks like: Liaise with product and delivery managers to understand client requirements. Design, develop and implement backend services and APIs using Python, Flask and FastAPI. Optimise the existing codebase to enhance performance and efficiency. Collaborate within a cross-functional team to deliver efficient solutions. Participate in code reviews to maintain high code quality standards. Troubleshoot and debug complex issues in the backend system. Contribute to high level technical architecture discussions and take opportunities to mentor and coach less experienced colleagues. Requirements Significant experience* building and maintaining production-grade web applications Commercial experience with our stack We know that years of experience level of skill, and we will consider candidates from a range of backgrounds. However, it is unlikely that candidates without several years of hands-on experience building software products will be able to contribute autonomously to our product. Nice to Have: Experience working with APIs and services Hands on experience working with document extraction and/or LLMs Some of the challenges we are solving Risk Digitization: Leveraging cutting-edge technologies for schema-driven risk extraction. Efficient Data Management: Handling large datasets swiftly and seamlessly across our platform. Workflow Optimization: Translating intricate business logic into streamlined workflows through the use of generic, configurable components for adaptability. Error Management: Implementing explicit error handling for clear communication with internal and external users. Benefits Stock options Enhanced parental leave Private health insurance - UK only* Choice of laptop Flexi-working £2000 travel budget Company trips We employ people across the UK and Spain (using a 3rd party Employer of Record model), and inevitably the benefits that we can offer vary slightly in different territories, due to local employment law and feasibility. Our salary range does not vary depending on territory. Location Cytora are a remote-first company. For this role you can be based anywhere in the UK or EU provided you 1. have fluent spoken and written English, and 2. have the permanent right to work without requiring visa sponsorship. Equal Opportunities We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Objective The goal is to grow the capabilities of the Practice to develop excellent AI solutions for us and for our clients  About the role Senior Principal Applied Scientist / Practice Competence Leader (SP / PCL) The main goal of SP is to lead and develop the capabilities of the experts within the Practice. These capabilities involve both hard skills (software engineering practices, data science, systems design, etc) and soft skills (presentations, writing, mentorship, risk-taking, etc). To develop these skills, the SP will create, maintain and integrate best practices via the AI Handbook, interview and hire the best talent, and mentor and coach Principal Data Scientists who lead individual projects. The ultimate target is flawless delivery of our projects thanks to the excellent team and their capabilities alongside public leadership in the field, thanks to the promotion of the state-of-the-art practices developed by us to the community. You will work closely with the Head of Practice to stay in touch with current demand and projects and with the Head of AI to stay on top of the technology.  KPIs Delivery - CSI, best practices adoption (to define exact metric) People - eNPS Areas of responsibility Setting up strategic technical direction and research for new tech opportunities Best practices development and change management Interviewing and hiring data scientists, principal data scientists Coaching, mentoring, sponsorship, and career development of principal data scientists Capabilities management in the Engineering department, developing domain expertise in the company Assisting educational and career development plans creation for data scientists Assisting demand generation (i.e. content development) and pre-sales activities (i.e. proposal presentation) recruit, train, promote, hire, and fire ML Delivery Managers Engineering handbook development, integration, and upgrades set the company's best practices, standards, and processes on how the work is done by raising the bar of industry standards to ensure executional excellence provide standard tools, methods, and systems to enable efficiency, best practices sharing, and effectiveness on a global scale help ML Delivery Managers to implement best practices and standards on all company projects  Skills Hands-on implementation of AI/ML solutions AI/ML systems design and architectures development MLOps and full machine learning solutions lifecycle Teaching, mentoring, and coaching Documentation development and knowledge organisation Effective written and oral communication Knowledge Software engineering best practices Machine learning best practices Systems design best practices (cloud, especially AWS will be a plus) Project management fundamentals Domain knowledge for the typical projects in practice (Retail, Logistics - nice to have) Product management fundamentals (nice to have) Business hypothesis testing (nice to have) Experience MSc or more advanced degree in Engineering, Mathematics, and other STEM fields 7+ years building and delivering AI/ML solutions 3+ years managing (project management, people management) AI/ML technical teams Experience in AI departments of top boutique consulting firms (BCG Gamma, McKinsey QuantumBlack, etc) or CTOs at prominent AI startups contribution to the tech community - writing, public speeches, open-source projects (nice to have) work in the startup environment, business hypothesis testing, product-market fit search (nice to have) Experience in domains of the typical projects in practice (Retail, Logistics - nice to have) We offer % from project margin % of stock option pool based on practice capitalization remote work from any location flexible working hours paid unlimited personal time off work with disruptive deep-tech startups scientific or engineering challenges meaningful social and environmental projects

Menhir Financial es una startup que aplica la Inteligencia Artificial para optimizar procesos y mejorar resultados, buscando transformar las compañías a partir del impacto basado en datos.  Estamos buscando un AI Developer con ganas de participar en todo el proceso de un proyecto de Inteligencia Artificial: análisis de datos, limpieza, preprocesamiento, desarrollo del modelo, optimización de hiperparámetros, backtesting, despliegue, diseño de infraestructura y puesta en producción.  Te enfrentarás a desafíos por resolver y tendrás un profundo impacto en el producto final. Trabajarás en un entorno ágil, con ingenieros increíbles que creen en nuestra misión. Buscamos un apasionado de los datos que disfrute aprendiendo y construyendo.  Tasks  Desarrollarás y desplegarás nuevos modelos de IA, que se utilizarán para analizar carteras, predecir resultados de comportamiento, descifrar el marketing mix y aumentar las oportunidades de negocio para nuestros clientes Analizarás datos, obteniendo gráficas y conclusiones relevantes Tomamos decisiones técnicas en equipo, escuchándonos unos a otros para llegar a buenas ideas. Nos gusta la cercanía, por lo que trabajarás mano a mano con los fundadores de esta empresa. Sabemos que el talento atrae al talento. Nos encantaría que ayudaras a incorporar a las personas con las que más te ha gustado trabajar. Requirements  Requisitos: \+3 años de experiencia como Data Scientist, Data Engineer o AI Developer Formación en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o alguna otra ingeniería Experiencia y eficiencia programando, con limpieza y buenas prácticas Capacidad para analizar datos en Python, obtener gráficas y obtener conclusiones Capacidad para desarrollar modelos de IA en Python, conocimiento de los frameworks y de los algoritmos más avanzados Conocimiento de BBDD: SQL Conocimiento de CI/CD, herramientas de construcción y despliegue (por ejemplo, Jenkins, Github Actions) y sistemas de monitorización Experiencia en el desarrollo de backend (Django Apps, API REST...) Experiencia con Docker, Kubernetes o contenedores en general Conocimiento de Git para control de versiones y trabajo en equipo Inglés Valoraremos: Independencia y ganas de aprender Experiencia en cloud Conocimiento de BBDD: NoSQL Haber trabajado en entornos de startups de ritmo rápido Otros idiomas Benefits  Beneficios: Sueldo competitivo Stock options Flexibilidad horaria: nos importa que puedas conciliar tu vida laboral con la personal El modelo de trabajo es semipresencial, se combina teletrabajo y presencialidad Seguro de salud cubierto en su totalidad por Menhir Entorno joven En Menhir somos un equipo de apasionados de los datos con una voluntad firme de transformar las organizaciones. ¿Te apuntas a formar parte del ecosistema Menhir?

ID de Job Opening 280  Duración del proyecto meses Largo Plazo  Idiomas Español  Área de conocimiento  Habilidades Big Data, HADOOP, Hive  Tarifa Candidato 260-280  Descripción del empleo Seleccionamos perfiles de Data Scientistpara participar en proyectos estratégicos y de innovación en vcliente líder en su sector.  Más de 4 años de experiencia como data scientist, de los cuales más de 2 años en Analítica Avanzada y al menos 1 año en Big Data. Tecnologías: R, Python y Scala.

Description About this role: The goal of the Data Scientist is to help deliver model-building projects to the business using technical skills and inquisitive nature. This role consists of Machine Learning, Data Extraction, Data Exploration, Statistics skills. A combination of these skillsets will help the team deliver accurate and ethical results on time. What you’ll do: Work with an HR Data Science Pod to help deliver key predictive and inferential models to the business. Create and execute against a project plan that includes building models or other data-driven products that help address those business needs. Maintain and deploy developed models interrogate data sources and modeling approaches with ethics and bias in mind. Quickly understanding new data sources and finding quick ways to extract information from them for modeling and inference purposes. Working with technical teams to bring developed models from exploration to deployment. Application of Machine Learning and Statistical methods which will be the most useful for HR processes. Testing models for fairness and bias and being conscious of the many ways in which bias can affect processes. Using an MLOps infrastructure to help build, deploy, and monitor created models. Understand business problems and translate them into models that drive result What you’ll need: Undergraduate or master’s degree in CS/Engineering, Statistics, STEM or Mathematical degrees Minimum of 2-4 yrs. work experience in Data Science Machine Learning (scikit-learn, PyTorch, Keras, etc.. ) Data Analysis (pandas) Data Extraction Programming proficiency in Python and R What you’ll get: Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity. Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities. #LI-KT3 Who are we? At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries. What makes Gartner a great place to work? Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner What we offer: Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.  The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity. En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del ámbito de la ingeniería. Actualmente contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con los clientes más innovadores de las ramas de I+D, automoción, pharma, diseño de maquinaria, desarrollo de producto, etc. En nuestra oficina técnica ofrecemos servicios en función de las necesidades de cada cliente, ya que en BETWEEN nos podemos hacer responsables de todas las tareas de desarrollo relacionadas con el ciclo de vida de su producto. Seleccionamos un Senior Data Scientist para incorporarse en uno de los equipos que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes. La persona seleccionada desarrollará algoritmos para aplicar en aplicaciones de Post Venta ¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales: Desarrollarás algoritmos para aplicar en aplicaciones de Post Venta Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios: Seguro médico con Sanitas. Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento. En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.  Imprescindible: Mínimo 4 años de experiencia como científico de datos: Amplia experiencia trabajando con SQL y lenguajes de scripting como R, Python y Scala. Comprensión profunda de los modelos de aprendizaje automático, sus fundamentos matemáticos y experiencia práctica con su desarrollo. Fuerte conocimiento de las tecnologías de la nube, especialmente Microsoft Azure Cloud. Capacidad para crear modelos de aprendizaje automático y obtener conocimientos en pocas palabras. Buen conocimiento de los procesos de marketing y ventas, especialmente en marketing digital y/o en el sector de la automoción y experiencia con analítica en esta área. Pensamiento analítico y capacidad para dirigir de forma independiente productos complejos. Nivel C1 de inglés Disponibilidad para viajar (máximo el 25% del tiempo de trabajo). Valorable: Buena capacidad de comunicación Disposición para aprender y demuestras fuertes habilidades de trabajo en equipo y presentación
