Senior Product Specialist Job Summary Location: Spain or Greece Contract Type: Permanent Reporting Line: Technical Manager / Team Leader Work Hours: 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday Who We Are Altair is leading the global convergence evolution toward smart, connected everything by delivering ground-breaking solutions in data analytics, simulation, high-performance computing, and smart connected products (IoT). You will find a different culture at Altair in the way we work, how we interact and the collaborative approach we bring to projects. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own. Your ideas are heard, your efforts are visible and your work impacts company growth. Communication is open and teamwork is encouraged. What You Will Do Work with Altair’s existing and prospective clients to solve problems, create value, improve growth, and maximise business efficiency and profitability through the implementation of Altair’s CAE product offering. Performance Areas Serve as a member of the worldwide EDEM Product team with the following responsibilities: · Generate Specifications for new features to be added to the software. · Oversee the feature development ensuring the output matches the specification. · Generate real world examples using EDEM and specifically new functionality to promote the software and verify that capabilities meet the needs of engineers. · Assist in the software Beta Program and management of QA/Testing activities. · Ensure that new functionality is well documented. · Work as the expert in one or more of EDEM’s coupled solutions. · Support Technical Support Team with new capabilities. · Perform performance benchmarks of the software. · Work with customers and various teams and disciplines to develop new ideas to solve complex business problems. In addition to this the wider Product Management Team which has the following general responsibilities: · Product Roadmap Management – Ensuring that EDEM continues to develop to meet customer needs and aligns with the company strategy. · Development and Testing – Lead the development of enhancements to the product in collaboration with the EDEM Software Development team. · Documentation – Ensure that suitable documentation is generated to assist users in using the software. · Support EDEM co-simulations – Manage, maintain, and promote EDEM co-simulation solutions with other products such as CFD, FEA and MBD. · Marketing, Sales, and Technical Team Support – generate examples of how EDEM can solve engineering problems, perform performance benchmarks, and support other teams in using the software. What You Will Need Qualifications · Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or other technical discipline Experience · Experience using CAE/CFD tools · Logical problem-solving approach and the ability to clearly communicate the situation and proposed solution to the customer · 3+ years of experience Preferred Requirements · Experience with programming languages (C++/Python or similar) · Experience with EDEM or Discrete Element Modelling (DEM) Soft Skills · Professional image and strong business acumen · Commercial awareness & attention to detail · Logical problem-solving skills, ability to demonstrate solutions coherently · Excellent interpersonal and teamworking skills · Good oral and written communication skills in fluent English · Self-motivation and strong organizational skills How You Will Be Successful: · Envision the Future · Communicate Honestly and Broadly · Seek Technology and Business “Firsts” · Embrace Diversity and Take Risks What We Offer: Collaborative environment Flex time Comprehensive benefit package Outstanding work/life balance Restricted stock program Professional and personal growth Why Work with Us: Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of data analytics, product development, and high-performance computing (HPC). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities. Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing. For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation, and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com. Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD Job Type: Full-time Pay: 40,000.00€ - 50,000.00€ per year Experience: Python: 3 years (Preferred) CAE: 3 years (Preferred) Ability to Commute: 08034 Barcelona (Required) Ability to Relocate: 08034 Barcelona: Relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in 08034 Barcelona

titulo: Project manager/ Engagement lead - Pricing analytics
descripcion: Who we are Our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere — every person, every organization, and every community around the globe. This motivates us — inspires us — to do what we do. To make what we make. To invent, and to reinvent. To engineer experiences that amaze. We won’t stop pushing ahead, because you won’t stop pushing ahead. You’re reinventing how you work. How you play. How you live. With our technology, you’ll reinvent your world. What we offer: Exciting work experience in a global organization, focused on Advanced Analytics initiatives; Career building platform - HP’s analytics team has a global footprint, offering many possibilities to advance one’s career; International, collaborative and dynamic team - we are a dynamic, highly skilled and diverse global team consisting of economists, consultants, marketers, statisticians, engineers, scientists and even musicians, united by the passion to create impact using technology. Position overview: In this position you would get the chance to shape the future of how we market and price our products by managing a global, cross-functional teams! Responsibilities: Drive WW analytics initiatives, partnering closely with Data Science team; Build and gain consensus on project proposals including benefits, budget, and resources; Create and manage partnerships with cross-functional teams to staff and execute on requirements; Manage the execution & delivery of analytics projects to our customers; Drive benefits and adoption of tools and recommendations that are a result of our analytics project deployments; Be main point of contact for the users, ensure training delivery and solution improvement based on their feedback; Present results and recommendations to relevant stakeholders, including senior leadership. About you: You are interested in customer and market behaviour and methods to measure and anticipate it; You are passionate about unveiling answers to most difficult questions, using data and models; You are keen on expanding your knowledge in advanced analytics; Knowledge and Skills: Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills; Ability to communicate abstract ideas clearly; Business acumen, technical knowledge within at least two business units, and extensive knowledge in applications and technologies; Very strong verbal and written communication skills, including negotiation, presentation, and influence; Excellent project management skills, including time and risk management, and project structuring; Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Economics, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus; Project Management certification: PMP or Agile preferred; Proven experience as a Project Manager, leading global cross functional initiatives; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information; Nice to have: Previous international experience, working in a global team is a plus; Previous work experience in Pricing related fields is also a plus.  About HP  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you. So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.  HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.  Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are. From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

descripcion: Remote or Office Work The Open Pricer Platform is used by major international logistics groups (parcel networks, road freight, e-commerce delivery). It is a key contributor to their financial performance through dynamic pricing¹. It also contributes to a sustainable supply chain by aiming to optimize the use of vehicle capacity. We are an innovative European software company with offices in Paris, Barcelona and Dubai. We are quickly expanding internationally to support several thousand users in 30+ countries. Our technology is based on real-time analysis and modeling of large amounts of operational, financial and sales data. Users access our platform either via our Web App or through APIs from other applications (CRM, Customer Portals, etc.). Our Delivery team is responsible for the setup and on-going improvement of the platform for our clients during the run phase. Delivery Engineers and Project Managers work directly with clients and configure the platform to meet their needs including Data Science / Machine Learning algorithms to deliver the best recommendations. They work closely with our pricing experts, data scientists, R&D and product management team. ¹ Dynamic prices are calculated instantly, optimized for every transaction and frequently updated to reflect market changes.  Your Missions Setup the Open Pricer platform for international logistics groups in relation with our project manager, pricing experts and DS/ML team; Implement the data connectors, the configuration of the platform, the generation of recommendations, and the measurement of performance; During the run phase: setup additional modules or change the configuration of existing ones; Develop tools to shorten the setup cycles and allow clients to easily modify the configuration by themselves. To enable you to quickly build your skills on the Open Pricer platform and understand the business needs of our clients, you will receive a two-weeks training course on our pricing methodology and technology in our office in Paris. You will then work closely with the team and receive additional training during workshops to become an expert in digital pricing.  Your Profile2 You graduated from an engineering school or equivalent. You have a general background in computer science and data science and are interested in their applications to improve business performance; You can quickly understand and analyze business requirements and take them into account when setting up the solution; With good interpersonal skills, you are comfortable with business and technical contacts; You have an experience in PYTHON (or R or JAVA) and SQL: You have an analytical, logical and rigorous mind; You know how to manage priorities and meet deadlines; You can communicate fluently with clients in English. Knowledge of French, German, Spanish or Portuguese is not mandatory but will be appreciated. 2 Hard skills are underlined  Our Added Value A booming solution with high added-value for business success (price optimization) and contributing to a sustainable world (reduction of GHG and pollutants thanks to optimized use of vehicles capacity); A dynamic and innovative company on a human scale with international clients in high growth sectors (E-Commerce - Supply Chain); An exciting scientific environment around Data Science and Machine Learning; An opportunity to develop your career in a new and growing area of expertise; Great coworking spaces in the center of Paris (Wojo - Saint-Lazare), Barcelona and Dubai, and soon in Brazil and the United States; Remote work was in our culture before the Covid crisis as the team was already working from different countries and locations. We meet daily online and physically when needed to develop team cohesion and boost creativity. Office work is always available for those who prefer; Permanent contract with attractive remuneration (fixed salary, bonus based on company success and employee shareholding).  Recruitment Process  HR Interview by external consultant Interview with Head of Delivery (in English) Technical test (online): PYTHON (or R or JAVA) and SQL - 1h Case study (online) - 1h Interview with Daniel Rueda (Founder and CEO)

About Abbott At Abbott, we’re dedicated to helping people live more fully, in everything we do. We’re creating the future of healthcare through life-changing technologies and products that make you healthier and stronger, quickly identify when you have a medical need, and treat conditions to help you get back to doing what you love. With headquarters in north suburban Chicago, we serve people in more than 160 countries with leading medical devices, diagnostics, nutrition products and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues are helping millions of people to live better and healthier, every day around the world. Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology. Working at Abbott At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You will have access to: Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of. A company named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune. A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists. The Opportunity This position works out of our Spain - Madrid location in the Structural Heart (SH) division. Our business purpose is to restore health and improve quality of life through the design and provision of device and management solutions for the treatment of structural heart disease. As a Supervisor Medical Sales , you’ll have the chance to sssure consistent implant and sales growth and achievement of sales goals and targets in assigned territory by identifying opportunities and gaining new business growing the market while maintaining existing business. What You’ll Do Case coverage Manage logistics between the site and Abbott related to procedural support Identify and assist in the resolution of issues of procedures Maintain Registry with the site Patient Recruitment Screen patients with echocardiologist to ensure that site personnel have the skills require to determine patient eligibility Call on referring physicians to present Mitraclip/ Triclip technology and the study data Organize outreach events for referring physicians. Dinner presentations, courses, etc. Help develop ´´promotional´´ materials for referring physicians to use in patient recruitment. Identify opportunities and implement programs to streamline patient screening and procedures scheduling. Clinical coverage Provide technical support to clinicians Mitral and Tricuspid Demonstrate procedural steps for all involved physicians and staff at sites. Conduct in-service programs for not only the Cath lab staff, but for ICU personnel as well Develop and implement field-based physician and staff training programs Communicate physician feedback and personnel input from case observations Management People Management & development ensuring the sales teams are focused on priority areas of business; building/maintaining close contact with key customers. Customer negotiation in the assigned area Grows the business/local market by identifying /encouraging the identification of new market niches and opportunities for MS products; developing/reviewing by customer visit and referral activities Other Work with Marketing to Develop materials according to Abbott policies Focus in Market development: Referral activities Assist in special projects and other activities as required. This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. When tasks and responsibilities are assigned outside the scope of normal duties, the employee must understand the level of decision making for which he/she is responsible and if in doubt clarify this with his/her supervisor Required Qualifications Education : Health Care Science BS/BA in life sciences or marketing Background: Cardiology and/or Surgery Knowledge Skills and experience Strong sales orientation Strong clinical orientation Versatile: able to influence a variety of clinician personality types Strong analytical skills: able to identify and resolve issue and adapt best practices across institutions Unsurpassed communication and interpersonal skills: to build relationships and obtain result Well-developed computer skills Ability to work 2D visualization to construct mental 3D device position Willingness to travel extensively (>30% of the time) Experience with products for use in international cardiology and cardiac surgery Familiarity of echocardiography or other indirect imaging is strong preferred Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity. Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

Line of Service Advisory Industry/Sector Not Applicable Specialism Data, Analytics & AI Management Level Associate Job Description & Summary PwC, Firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio. La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Data Scientist, Analytics y Business Security Solutions. En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics profesionales para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado. Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PwC en Málaga, Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo. Perfil BackEnd: profesional con al menos 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo con Python. Requisitos: Ingeniería Superior: Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar. Experiencia en tratamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos, en entornos tradicionales o Big Data. ETLs. Desarrollo de software, preferiblemente con Python. Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos analíticos, machine learning, data mining. Integración de sistemas. Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server...) Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua. Sistema de control de versiones Git. Metodologías ágiles. Conocimiento de tecnología Apache Spark y/o Hadoop. Nivel alto de inglés. Perfil FrontEnd: profesional con al menos 3 años de experiencia. Requisitos: Ing. Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar. Experiencia de 2-3 años demostrable en Proyectos FrontEnd. Buen dominio de Javascript y TypeScript. Además buen conocimiento de ECMAScript 6. Experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Responsive de una sola página, sólida experiencia con Angular 2+. Experiencia en diseño de soluciones front (Bootstrap o material design). Experiencia con bibliotecas de gráficos (Highcharts, plotly, D3). Experiencia con sistemas de control de versiones (Git y GitHub). - Experiencia con metodologías ágiles (marco SCRUM) y prácticas de Integración Continua. - Nivel alto de inglés Se valorará positivamente experiencia adicional sobre: experiencia en JS frameworks (VueJS, React) y Conocimiento UX/UI (Figma, Sketch, Zeplin) Perfil Scrum Master: profesional con 3 - 5 años de experiencia. Requisitos: Ingeniería Superior: Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar. Experiencia en tratamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos, en entornos tradicionales o Big Data. Conocimiento en marcos ágiles / scrum y éxito comprobado trabajando en un entorno ágil. Conocimientos en Python. Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos analíticos, machine learning, data mining. Integración de sistemas. Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server...). Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua. Metodologías ágiles. Certificación CSM (Certified Scrum Master). Nivel alto de inglés. Perfil DevOps: profesional con 4-6 años de experiencia. Requisitos: Experiencia en administración de plataformas cloud, preferiblemente con plataforma, aunque también valorable AWS, Google Cloud... Administración de sistemas: Preferiblemente Linux. Automatización procesos e integración de sistemas. Scripting con Tyhon, Powershell, Shell script... Manejo de bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (MongoDB...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server...). Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua. Sistema de control de versiones Git. Metodologías ágiles. Deseable conocimiento en tecnología Apache Spark y Hadoop Valorable certificaciones: Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions y/o Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions. Nivel alto de inglés. If you're here, it's because you're looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone. We'll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together. Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B€ in sales through our platform and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes. Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose. What makes our ride unique? Our culture and strong values. We have an ''office-first'' culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don't shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don't believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. Our commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities. We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts. YOUR MISSION Glovo is building the future of cities by enabling anyone to get any product from any store in their city delivered in minutes. Our goal is to provide on-demand delivery infrastructure for every city in the world. In order for us to do this in a reliable fashion, we are looking for a talented Senior Fraud Analyst to join our team. This is a great opportunity to join our rapidly growing Fintech & Risk team within Glovo. We are constantly developing new techniques to detect and counter fraudulent and malicious actors who are constantly developing new techniques to abuse our platform. You'll be working alongside our engineering and product team to constantly drive us to innovate while we shape the vision for the team. THE JOURNEY Mentor and develop 3 Risk Decision Scientists. Investigate, analyze, and understand fraud & credit losses using statistical tools and on-the-ground research. Assist in developing real-time decisioning and automated fraud detection strategies. Propose solutions to minimize the risk of fraud and manage fraud detection tools, while creating rules and analyzing fraud patterns. Implement experimentations (e.g. A/B test) to mitigate fraud loss rate and customer experience. Help improve Machine Learning models accuracy and efficiency. Chargeback and cash management: Review and defend customer payment disputes (fraudulent and non-fraudulent ones). Understand business needs and create insightful analysis to enable the leadership teams to answer their needs. Write queries and perform ad hoc data analysis to keep the nerve centre of our operations engine running at full speed. WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE RIDE 3-5 years of experience in a similar role. BS/BA or higher degree in a quantitative field, computer science, engineering or extensive experience in operations management. Outstanding English speaking and writing skills (internal work language). Experience in SQL with the ability to analyze large quantities of data using statistical analysis tools such as Python, and working with modern BI tools like Tableau or Looker. Experience in identifying gaps in business strategy, with a focus on fraud. Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills with a bias toward action and a get things done attitude. Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams. Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable. We believe driven talent deserves: An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action. Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak. Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings! Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses. Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized. ️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year! Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery. Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being. Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc). So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

As data analyst in the Pricing Analytics COE, you will work closely with Data engineers and Data scientists, playing a crucial role in data validation and data preparation for our pricing analytics projects. One of your main responsibilities will be to translate the business requirements into technical and data needs, while as second responsibility, you will be analyzing the data to drive insights that can support monitoring for our live projects. About you: You are a data driven person, with a passion to identify patterns in the data, identify the root cause, and propose solutions; You have experience in creating / maintaining ETL pipelines; You have experience with data stewardship, ensuring data accessibility, accuracy, and completeness; You are passionate about coding, simplifying the complex, automation and making processes more efficient. What you will be doing: Collaborate with technical teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability for analysis; Perform UAT on new data feeds and translate business requirements to Data Engineering team; Identify opportunities to simplify and automate data pipelines; Conduct data analysis to gain insights into business processes, performance, and trends; Identify opportunities to automate data analyses and streamline reporting; Leverage ETL pipelines in R / Python as well as analytics/visualization tools like Excel, PowerBI and Tableau to transform raw data into meaningful insights. What we are looking for (Must-haves): At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and business analysis; Experience in any of R, Python, PySpark, Spark; Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, PowerBI/Tableau; Excellent analytical thinking, creativity and problem-solving skills; Strong verbal and written communication/presentation skills Bachelor or Master's degree in Business, Economics or any relevant field; Nice to have: Experience with Jira or similar project management and issue tracking tools; Experience in deploying ML and data science solutions; Experience with data management tools as Databricks or similar; Basic understanding of finance and product economics.  About HP  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you. So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.  HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.  Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are. From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
