Craft: Data, Analytics & Strategy Job Description: Your role in the Kingdom  Join the forefront of mobile game development at King as a Product Manager MBA Intern in our New Games studio. In this dynamic role, you’ll play a pivotal part in shaping the future of our new casual and mid- core titles, directly impacting player experience.  You will work with amazing Product Managers, Game Designers, Economy Designers, Data Scientists, Artists, Developers and Producers as well as colleagues across teams such as Marketing, Player Insights and Market Competitive Intelligence.  You will: Collaborate with the team to define the strategy, roadmap and plans for your areas of responsibility on a game, aligning it with the overall game experience and business goals Proactively craft, identify and develop creative ideas and new opportunities to push your game forward Write and collaborate on clear product, feature and test specifications Find opportunities by drawing from all available insights, including Data Analyses, AB tests, lessons from Activision Blizzard King, Competitor and Market Analyses and User Research Combine quantitative and qualitative analysis to analyse play tests, AB tests, feature releases, monitor game performance, identify opportunities to fine- tune the game Present findings from your work in a clear and concise way to your team and stakeholders Stay up- to- date with industry trends and player preferences to inform the product Share best practice across the team and the wider King organization  Skills to create thrills You are a passionate problem solver and have the ability to draw data- driven business insights. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast- paced and collaborative environment whilst communicating efficiently with teams and individuals across new games.  You are: Interested in mobile products and motivated by how to use data to make them better Highly analytical, with experience in data- driven and insight based decision making Interest in gaming and understanding of the mechanics of free- to- play games Talented in building relationships, influencing and communicating Able to present analysis and research in an impactful way Able to work in self- directed, fast- paced and results- oriented entrepreneurial environments Curious, empathic and a good teammate  And for bonus points? Passion for mobile games and a solid understanding of the industry  The skills listed above are intended to portray the range of roles we have available; you do not need to possess all of these skills to apply! We will look at your own individual skill set and determine which team you would be best suited to.  We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under- represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.  Want to join our Kingdom? Apply now! Positions are available in Barcelona & London, applications need to be in English. Our internships will last for 10 weeks, starting in June 2024 and ending in August 2024. Early application is advised to avoid disappointment.  The brilliant experience we give our players comes from the diversity and experience of our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent.  We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest About King King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta. A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. Making the World Playful Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful! Applications need to be in English. Discover King at careers.king.com

Company Description  Work with Us. Change the World.  At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.  There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.  We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.  Job Description  We are currently recruiting a BIM Coordinator to join our expanding structural department.  In AECOM, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. You will be working on a wide range of projects including bridges, viaducts, earth retaining structures, cut and cover tunnels, underground structures, culverts and building structures. The role offers the opportunity to work across all the stages, from concept to preliminary and detailed designs.  Our group has an established track record of successfully delivering bridge engineering design for many years, throughout the USA, Australia, Canada and Middle East. You may have the opportunity to work on some of the most iconic transportation projects, being part of a diverse and multicultural team. It can be a great opportunity for a BIM Coordinator that wants to boost his/her professional career on structural modeling.  The responsibilities of this role include  + Develop Building Information Modelling (BIM) models for the discipline of structures associated with transport infrastructures (bridges, viaducts, cut and cover tunnels, buildings, etc), typically from LOD 200 to LOD350.  + Ensure that models are aligned with the standards and goals set in the BIM Execution plan.  + Create and develop structural BIM content.  + Drawing production including reinforcement drawings, structural steel details, etc.  + Works in a team-based environment that involves coordination with colleagues based in different offices.  + Model audit for quality assurance following the QAQC procedure.  + Performs the responsibilities under limited supervision.  Minimum Requirements  + Experience developing BIM Models and working on drawing production (+6 years) for the discipline of structures associated to transport infrastructures.  + Excellent knowledge of modelling and drawing using Autodesk Revit.  + Experienced using common data environments Autodesk Construction Cloud (BIM360).  + Knowledge of BIM technologies, processes, requirements, and standards.  + Fluent in English (oral and written).  + Experience working for clients in the USA, Canada and Australia will be considered favorable.  Preferred Qualifications  + Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management or a related field is preferred.  + Certificated BIM education or proven experience in BIM projects in the field of civil/structural engineering works.  Qualifications  Additional Information  About AECOM  AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.  Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity  You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.  Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  ReqID: J10097537  Business Line: Transportation  Business Group: DCS  Strategic Business Unit: Enterprise Capabilities  Career Area: Digital & Engineering Technology  Work Location Model: Hybrid

titulo: Ingeniero de Datos para Marketing_Sr Analyst
descripcion: There will never be a typical day at Accenture Digital, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Our clients operate at scale in international markets – you’ll be working with famous brands and household names – no worrying about how to explain what you do to your family again! We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us. Responsibilities for Data Engineer Create and maintain optimal data pipeline and ETL process, Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional non functional business requirements. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.  Requirements Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. 3 years of experience in a Data Engineer role Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow, Terraform, Composer etc. Experience with cloud services such as Google Cloud Storage, BigQuery Experience using Python and Java for data transformation

titulo: Research assistant in Computational Solid Mechanics
descripcion: The Computational Solid Mechanics Group at IMDEA Materials Institute is seeking to fill a position of Research Assistant to work on Hybrid physics-based and data-driven models for computational solid and materials mechanics. The researcher will work on the development of finite element models for complex thermomechanical processes and their surrogate approximation using machine learning methods. OTHER DETAILS Ref. num. 2023-IR-R1-109 Research assistant in Computational Solid Mechanics In Evaluation. It is not possible to apply anymore IMDEA Materials Institute is a public research organization founded in 2007 by Madrid’s regional government to carry out research of excellence in Material Science and Engineering by attracting talent from all over the world to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment. IMDEA Materials has grown rapidly since its foundation and currently includes more than 120 researchers from 22 nationalities and has become one of the leading research centers in materials in Europe which has received the María de Maeztu seal of excellence from the Spanish government. The research activities have been focused on the areas of materials for transport, energy, and health care and the Institute has state-of-the-art facilities for processing, characterization and simulation of advanced materials.   Description The Computational Solid Mechanics Group at IMDEA Materials Institute is seeking to fill a position of Research Assistant to work on Hybrid physics-based and data-driven models for computational solid and materials mechanics. The researcher will work on the development of finite element models for complex thermomechanical processes and their surrogate approximation using machine learning methods. In particular, the hired researcher will be involved in two publicly funded projects: one will entail the modelling of additive manufacturing and the other one, the predition of fatigue life of steels. Both problems will involve using Statistics, Mathematics, Programming and Machine Learning. The researcher will be enrolled in a PhD program and carry out his/her PhD dissertation while working at IMDEA. IMDEA Materials (Madrid Institute for Advanced Studies of Materials) is a non-profit, independent research institute, promoted by the Regional Government de Madrid (Spain), to carry out research in Materials Science and Engineering. IMDEA Materials Institute is committed to excellence in research by attracting talent from all over the world and to foster technology transfer to the industrial sector in a truly international environment. IMDEA Materials Institute holds the "María de Maeztu" seal of excellence, awarded to the best research centres in Spain. As part of its commitment to bring the best research talent to Madrid, IMDEA Materials Institute endorsed in 2007 the European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers that set out the rules and obligations of researchers, their employers and funders, as well as transparent and fair recruitment procedures. The Institute received the ‘HR Excellence in research’ award in October 2015.   Requirements Candidates should have strong analytical skills and hold a MSc in Engineering, Material Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Physics with an excellent academic record. Additionally, successful candidates are expected to be fluent in spoken and written English and have programming experience in C++ and/or Python. Interested candidates should submit the Curriculum Vitae, academic records for the BS and the MSc degrees, and a letter of motivation focusing on previous experience, interests, and personal goals.   Conditions - Full-time contract, including social security coverage. - Salary of 21.300 €/year. - Enrolment in a PhD program of the Technical University of Madrid (UPM) and supervision. - Opportunity to attend international conferences. - Integration in an international environment with career training (language classes, soft skills, article preparation, proposal writing, etc.) The candidate is expected to join the Institute in January 2024.   Applications are processed upon reception. The position might be closed once ten working days have passed since publication, so we encourage early application. The working language of the Institute is English. Full command of the English language is required in all positions.  WHAT YOU WILL FIND AT IMDEA:  Stimulating environment where you can grow professionally.  IMDEA Materials Institute is committed to equal opportunities, diversity and the promotion of a healthy work environment and work-life balance. Female applicants are encouraged to apply to our research and technical positions. Besides on-the-job technical training, IMDEA Materials Institute is committed to training the Institute’s scientists and staff in “soft” or transversal skills

titulo: Postdoctoral Fellow for the Inflammation, Tissue...
descripcion: Created in 2005 by the Generalitat de Catalunya (Government of Catalonia) and the University of Barcelona, IRB Barcelona is a Severo Ochoa Centre of Excellence—a seal that was awarded in 2011. The institute is devoted to conducting research of excellence in biomedicine and to transferring results to clinical practice, thus improving people’s quality of life, while simultaneously promoting the training of outstanding researchers, technology transfer, and public communication of science. Its 29 laboratories and seven core facilities address basic questions in biology and are orientated to diseases such as cancer, metastasis, Alzheimer’s, diabetes, and rare conditions. IRB Barcelona is an international centre that hosts 500 members and 45 nationalities. It is located in the Barcelona Science Park. IRB Barcelona forms part of the Barcelona Institute of Science and Technology (BIST) and the “Xarxa de Centres de Recerca de Catalunya” (CERCA).  IRB Barcelona is seeking a postdoctoral fellow for an immediate start in the “Inflammation, Tissue Plasticity & Cancer” laboratory led by Dr. Direna Alonso-Curbelo. Our lab aims to understand how oncogenic mutations and environmental insults alter normal cellular identity and tissue homeostasis to drive cancer development, with a focus on pancreatic and liver cancers. To do so, we combine functional genomics tools (CRISPR/Cas9; RNAi), mouse models and organoid/cell culture systems, and (epi)genomic methods including single-cell technologies. The successful candidate will lead an ambitious project dissecting local and systemic immune responses underlying early tumor evolution and therapy responses in pancreatic cancer, and develop state-of-the-art genetic approaches and in vivo models to establish their functional significance. Our ultimate goal is to understand how the immune system is co-opted during cancer development and identify actionable strategies to detect and/or block cancer-specific immune cell states and networks. Prior experience with mouse models and genome editing tools is required, and knowledge in immunology and cancer biology will be favorably considered. The successful candidate will benefit from a dynamic research environment of a multidisciplinary group with several national and international projects, have access to state-of-the-art technologies and computational infrastructures, and join our new Consortium SIMMBAP (Systemic IMMunological determinants of tumor evolution and therapy response in BRCA-mutated pancreatic cancer) integrating clinical investigators, cancer biologists, and computational scientists. They will be provided with training in hard and soft skills, and will also have opportunities to mentor junior researchers and incoming lab members. Starting date: as soon as possible. This position will be partially covered by the project TRANSCAN-3 Project SIMMBAP, investigating immunological mechanisms of tumor initiation and therapy responses. A project which has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme under grant agreement No. 964264. The position is for 3 years, with a possibility of extension subject to availability of funding.  DUTIES: Research: Conduct independent research in molecular and microenvironmental mechanisms of cancer pathogenesis. Work in a team and set up flexible preclinical pipelines to interrogate disease mechanisms in vitro and in vivo. Mentoring & team management: Engage in the training of students and assist the Principal Investigator with the supervision and management of the lab. Communication: Manuscript preparation, seminar/conference presentations, grant writing.  EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS: Must Have – Required: Experience: PhD in molecular biology, cell biology, biomedicine or similar. Background in cancer biology or immunology. At least 1 first-author publication. Experience in at least one of the following approaches/tools: mouse models, functional genomics tools, epigenomics and/or single-cell technologies, and immune cell engineering. Knowledge: Extensive laboratory experience, including in cloning, cell culture, functional genetics (CRISPR/Cas9 and/or RNAi), flow cytometry, and mouse models. Strong interest in exploring microenvironmental mechanisms of tumor evolution, involving (epi)genetics and tumor-host crosstalk. Skills: Languages: Excellent communication skills in English (oral and written). Proactive person, motivated to learn new technologies, analysis workflows and concepts. Ability to work independently as well as in a team. Good organizational skills: ability to coordinate and perform multiple tasks; time- and deadline-management. Enjoys solving challenging scientific questions in a fast-paced environment. Motivated to mentor younger scientists on the team. Desirable: Experience: Background in pancreatic cancer, epigenetics, inflammation and/or immune surveillance. Prior experience in competitive research environments. Knowledge: Flow cytometric immunophenotyping, histology. Culture and genetic modification of primary immune cells. Omics methods (transcriptomics/epigenomics, single-cell RNA/ATAC-seq; imaging/spatial proteomics, mass cytometry/CyTOF). Skills: Solid understanding of biostatistics and expertise/interest in single-cell data analyses (scRNA-seq/scATAC-seq/multiomics).  WORKING CONDITIONS & ENTITLEMENTS: Working conditions: Employed in compliance with Spanish legislation and regulations under a full-time contract. Employees receive the benefits of the Spanish Social Security system covering sickness, maternity/paternity leaves and injuries at work. Desk space (with a computer) and a working bench are provided to each member of the team. The unique opportunity to lead cancer biology and immunology research within a multidisciplinary group with several national and international projects, and leverage an extensive research network within the SIMMBAP Consortium, which will connect you to leading cancer biologists, physicians, and bioinformaticians across Europe. Funded short-term stays at SIMMBAP Consortium groups will also be possible. Continuous training opportunities in an excellent and dynamic scientific environment, with ample professional career opportunities. Postdoctoral researchers joining IRB Barcelona gain access to the Institute’s advanced research training and career development opportunities. International Environment: The opportunity to join a prestigious, diverse and inclusive international research institution Estimated annual gross salary: Salary commensurate with experience and qualifications  HOW TO APPLY & SELECTION PROCESS: Applications for the above opening should include a Motivation Letter and Full CV (including references). Deadline for applications: 18/01/2024 (If no suitable candidate is found, the deadline will be extended) Number of positions available: 1 Selection process: Pre-selection: Will be based on CV, motivation letter & experience. Interviews: Short-listed candidates will be interviewed. Job offer: Will be sent to the successful candidate after the interview.  Note: The strengths and weaknesses of the applications will be provided upon request.

Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be and take their careers further. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and the sky is the limit thinking in a cloud-enabled world.  Microsoft’s Azure Data engineering team is leading the transformation of analytics in the world of data with products like databases, data integration, big data analytics, messaging & real-time analytics, and business intelligence. The products our portfolio include Microsoft Fabric, Azure SQL DB, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure PostgreSQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid, and Power BI. Our mission is to build the data platform for the age of AI, powering a new class of data-first applications and driving a data culture.  Within Azure Data, the Big Data Analytics team provides a range of products that enable data engineers and data scientists to extract intelligence from all data – structured, semi-structured, and unstructured. We are in the process of integrating our disparate products into Azure Synapse Analytics with a set of experiences that are meant to simplify and accelerate time to value. The Azure Big Data team builds reliable, highly scalable and performant data analytics solutions on Azure. In order to meet the needs of the Python data scientists, the SCOPE team is designing PySCOPE; a Python centric solution that exposes the computational power of the SCOPE analytical engine via a standard Pandas API, for the Python community. This architecture enables Python developers to leverage the familiarity of Pandas, but scale their data processing and analytics code to petabyte-scale without needing to overly focus on parallelization or resource management.  We do not just value differences or different perspectives. We seek them out and invite them in so we can tap into the collective power of everyone in the company. As a result, our customers are better served. Responsibilities The SCOPE team is responsible for (4) significant areas: compilation, query optimization, runtime execution, distributed job scheduling across hundreds of thousands of machines.  As part of the SCOPE team you will be a part of a small development team focused on distributed systems, data analytics, logical plans, code generation, execution (cloud and local), and advancing our analytical capabilities for our customers. Specifically, this position offers the ability to learn leading edge approaches in the field of big data analytics, apply your Python and Pandas experience to directly shape our Python solution, and have real business and customer impact in that eco-system. You will have the opportunity to iterate with our existing large SCOPE customer base, partner with our upcoming Python data-scientists, and personally advance our capabilities to meet their requirements. Qualifications Required/Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline AND relevant years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. Relevant years of professional experience in Python and Pandas.  Other Requirements  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  Preferred/Additional Qualifications  Industry experience with Pandas API, Arrow type-system, and NumPy. Experience with Python and .Net and interoperability. Experience in distributed systems and data-analytics. Experience in query computation, optimization, and relational algebra.  #azdat #azuredata #analytics #databases #python #dotnet Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

The Institute The Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG) is an international biomedical research institute of excellence, based in Barcelona, Spain, with more than 400 scientists from 44 countries. The CRG is composed by an interdisciplinary, motivated and creative scientific team which is supported both by a flexible and efficient administration and by high-end and innovative technologies. In April 2021, the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG) received the renewal of the 'HR Excellence in Research' Award from the European Commission. This is a recognition of the Institute's commitment to developing an HR Strategy for Researchers, designed to bring the practices and procedures in line with the principles of the European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers (Charter and Code). Please, check out our Recruitment Policy The role The position is expected to be filled by a PhD-level candidate with experience in bioimage analysis and advanced fluorescence microscopy. The candidate will focus on the application of live cell fluoresce microscopy to study single cell and multicellular dynamics and the analysis of spatio-temporal features regulating morphodynamics and pattern formation. The candidate should be enthusiastic to work in a collaborative and interdisciplinary research environment. This work will be performed within the European Synergy Grant ‘Breakdance’ that involves 4 European research partners in Spain and France. About the lab The Ruprecht lab studies fundamental mechanisms regulating cellular morphodynamics, tissue plasticity and multicellular self-organization during development and disease conditions. The team employs a cross-disciplinary approach that combines quantitative fluorescence microscopy, biophysical methods, synthetic biology approaches and in vivo model systems. Our work has recently identified that nuclear mechanosensing controls cellular mechano-plasticity (Venturini et al. Science 2020) and has elucidated mechanisms of developmental robustness via cellular error correction in the early embryo (Hoijman et al. Nature 2020). Our ultimate goal is to develop a mechanistic understanding how tissue form and function is robustly built and maintained by dynamic processes at the single cell level and of alterations of cell states in disease and ageing. The research group is part of the Quantitative Cell Biology Program and Systems and Synthetic Biology Program at the CRG. Whom would we like to hire? Professional experience Must Have You have expertise in bioimage analysis and advanced fluorescence microscopy methods You have developed computational tools for image processing and analysis Education and training You hold a PhD degree in physics, mathematics, informatics or a related field with relevant qualifications Languages You are fluent in English, and you have excellent communication and writing skills Competences You are a highly motivated person with analytical problem-solving skills You bring an excellent scientific track record You are enthusiastic to work in a collaborative and interdisciplinary research team Technical skills You have worked with 2D, 3D and 4D live cell fluorescence microscopy data You have experience in handling multi-modal imaging data (widefield, confocal, light sheet microscopy) You have gained practical skills in AI-based image analysis methods You bring experience in different programming languages (Matlab, Phyton, Fiji, and similar) You are proficient in statistical data analysis You are knowledgeable in cell and developmental biology The Offer – Working Conditions Contract duration: Technical and scientific activities contract - estimated project duration one year with the possibility to extend Estimated annual gross salary: Salary is commensurate with qualifications and consistent with our pay scales. Target start date: as from January 2024 We provide a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructures, and unique professional career development opportunities. To check out our training and development portfolio, please visit our website in the training section. We offer and promote a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applicants regardless of age, disability, gender, nationality, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or gender identity. The CRG is committed to reconcile a work and family life of its employees and are offering extended vacation period and the possibility to benefit from flexible working hours.

Big Decisions Big Decisions takes the guesswork out of marketing. Our mission is to provide our clients with products that enable better business and marketing decision making, powered with the information gleaned from data. This data might come from our clients and relate to their own customers and marketing activities, or from third party sources. We use data science tools, techniques and platforms to build products that support business decision making and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of marketing and sales operations. Most of our clients are B2B technology manufacturers and resellers, and marketing organisations. We use data creatively, and we encourage a creative approach to our work. We seek to hire curious, innovative individuals who will craft their ideas into products that are scalable and commercial. Big Decisions is a Madrid-based company consisting primarily of data scientists and data engineers. We are a supportive organisation, valuing our employees, and we are proud to offer flexible working arrangements. Role overview We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Team. The Data Engineer will be responsible for optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, taking care of improving data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The Data Engineer will also be part of the product development process, and as such will be required to be innovative and creative in their approach to data systems, management and outputs. They must be comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. Main responsibilities Work within the data science team and very closely with our Data Scientists to support greater functionality in our data systems and models; Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, etc; Develop, test and maintain optimal data pipeline architectures (such as large-scale processing systems) and ensure that these meet business requirements; Assemble large, complex data sets leveraging internal and external data sources; Build or support the infrastructure required for optimal ETL from a wide variety of data sources using appropriate technologies. Understand and address data security issues. Required Skills - We are looking for a candidate with education in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have working experience using the following software/tools: Relational SQL and NoSQL databases: MySQL, MongoDB, etc. Scripting languages: Python. Good to have : Java, C++, Scala, etc. At least one of: Azure cloud services, AWS cloud services (EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift) and/or Google Cloud Services Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. Good knowledge of software architecture design for larger scale scripts; - Time management and organizational skills: the candidate will have to be able to scope projects and pro-actively understand projects opportunities; - Ability to produce documentation; - Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment, preferably in marketing; - Microsoft Excel (some knowledge or previous experience of VBA is also a plus) Additional desired skills Ability to analyse and gain insights from data Data Visualization An understanding of machine learning and statistical modelling techniques Job Type: Full-time Salary: 24,000.00€ - 29,000.00€ per year Application Question(s): Do you live in Spain or do you have the necessary documentation to work in Spain? Language: English (Required) Work Location: In person

titulo: Consultoría | Senior Associate DevOps Hub Málaga

If you're here, it's because you're looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people's lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together! Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B€ in sales and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes. Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose. What makes our ride unique? Our culture and strong values. We have an ''office-first'' culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don't shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. Our career development philosophy. We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. We take ownership of our career development. We don't believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. Our commitment to being a force for good. Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities. We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts. Your mission: Join our product-centered business unit where data is at the core of product development. As a Data Manager at Glovo, you will be instrumental in harnessing data to empower key business and product leads, analysts and data scientists. Your day-to-day will involve engaging with Product, Engineering and Data teams to ensure the process of producing data and deriving insights from it is reliable, scalable and impactful. You will lead by example, demonstrating technical excellence and best practices, while fostering an inclusive environment that encourages growth and success through continuous coaching and mentoring. Be a part of a team where you will: Recruit, guide, manage, and grow a high-performing multi-craft team of Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Product Data Scientists of different seniority levels. Create synergies across Business, Product, and Engineering to prioritize the most impactful Data Products, enabling Glovo's mission. Manage the entire lifecycle of your team's projects, from OKRs definition to efficient execution and value delivery. Contribute to Glovo's Data Mesh strategy and collaborate across departments to improve our overall Data capabilities. Lead architectural and data modeling discussions (RFCs, Design Documents, …), contribute to technical decisions, and drive impactful contributions to our code base and ways of working. Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights through dashboards, and analytics techniques. Improve data discovery and literacy by developing and maintaining scalable and self-service visualization tools and dashboards, promoting their use across the company. What you will bring to the ride: 5+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, or a similar role, with at least 2+ years of experience managing a team (5+ people) and multiple projects. Experience designing and building scalable and maintainable data processing systems (both batch and near/real-time) and data models that enable data-driven business decisions and product development. Strong Product Sense, as you will be working with the most Product-oriented organization within Glovo, and Project Management skills, with the ability to act as a Data Product Manager if required. Proficiency in SQL and Python, knowledge of cloud data warehouses (Redshift) and distributed data processing frameworks (Spark, Presto). A good understanding of Software Development best practices and Agile methodologies. Knowledge of Data Mesh principles with hands-on implementation experience. Expertise in Data Analytics and Visualization tools (Looker, Amplitude). Knowledgeable and experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc). Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally with leaders in Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams to unlock new opportunities. Proficiency in English. Desirable skills: Familiarity with data processing tools (dbt, Delta Lake), streaming, Data Lake cloud architectures, and containerization tools (Docker). Experience with CI/CD tools and AWS services such as EMR, Glue, MWAA, and infrastructure as code. Familiarity with statistical programming languages (Python/R) and experience with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown. Ultimately, if you are an exceptional people manager who is passionate about data quality and eager to make an impact through leading teams that create analytical tools, understand users and products in depth, and identify business opportunities for growth and optimization, we want you on our team. Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable. We believe driven talent deserves: An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action. Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak. Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings. Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses. Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized. ️Extra time off! The freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year! Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery. Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being. An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth. Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc). So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Everything happens somewhere - which is why spatial analytics is fundamental to companies trying to understand the “where” and the “why” of their business. CARTO is the leading cloud-native location intelligence platform, trusted by data scientists, data analysts and developers from companies such as T-Mobile, Mastercard, NHL, Coca-Cola and Gap to provide geospatial insights for use cases such as site selection, geomarketing, route optimization, network planning and much more.  With an exceptionally diverse team of 170 people spread across the US and Europe, CARTO (backed by Insight Partners, Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, among others) is changing the way companies analyze location data - making it simple to do this straight out of modern, cloud data warehouses. Redefining its category, the company has grown rapidly in recent years providing a compelling alternative to legacy GIS software.  We are seeking a dynamic, hands-on Vice President of Marketing to lead our marketing efforts and drive the next phase of our company's growth. Reporting to the CEO, the ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of strategic vision, tactical execution, and a deep understanding of B2B SaaS marketing, particularly targeting the enterprise.  This position is remote. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Leadership: Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies that align with the company's objectives, increase brand awareness, and drive demand generation. Demand Generation: Execute and optimize campaigns across all channels to generate high-quality leads for the sales team. Monitor and report on lead conversion and ROI. Account-Based Marketing (ABM): Oversee the design and execution of targeted marketing campaigns that resonate with specific high-value accounts, driving deeper engagement and conversions. Partner Marketing: Build and nurture strategic partnerships, developing joint marketing initiatives to tap into new markets and revenue streams. Product Marketing Collaboration: Work closely with the product team to ensure alignment between product development and market demands. Oversee the creation of product marketing materials, messaging, and launch strategies. Events: While we are strong in this area, further refine our event strategy, ensuring optimal ROI and brand visibility. Marketing Automation: Ensure the effective utilization of existing marketing automation tools and systems. Evaluate new tools that could further enhance our marketing efforts. Team Leadership: Build, mentor, and manage the marketing team, ensuring they are set up for success in their roles and projects. Budget Management: Allocate and manage the marketing budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources across projects and campaigns. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Minimum of 10 years of professional marketing experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership role. Proven track record in B2B SaaS marketing, especially within the analytics domain. Deep expertise in demand generation, ABM, and partner marketing. Experience with marketing automation tools and platforms. Strong project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional teams. Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills. What We Offer: Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Opportunity to be part of a forward-thinking company, shaping the future of modern geospatial analytics. Comprehensive benefits package. A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive workplace culture. To Apply  Do you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.  A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, age, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.  To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq).Not the right job for you? Take a look at the rest of our openings at carto.com/careers #LI-Remote

Full-time – 40 hours per week Location: Remote One of our exciting start-up iGaming clients is looking for an Affiliate to help grow their customers base across their diverse product offering in both sportsbook and casino. Job Description We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced iGaming Risk Manager with a robust background in data analysis. As an iGaming Risk Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing risk assessment, implementing mitigation strategies, ensuring regulatory compliance, developing incident response protocols, and utilising data analysis to optimise NGR/GGR percentages per game. This role necessitates a strategic thinker with a keen understanding of the iGaming industry and a passion for leveraging data to make informed decisions. Responsibilities Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Develop and implement comprehensive risk assessment strategies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams for effective risk mitigation plans. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of risk mitigation measures. Data Analysis: Utilise advanced data analysis techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets. Identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in player behaviour, transactions, and other relevant data. Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to develop predictive models for risk management. Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on iGaming industry regulations. Ensure compliance with local and international gaming laws. Work closely with legal and compliance teams for robust frameworks. Incident Response: Develop and implement incident response protocols. Coordinate with teams to investigate incidents and implement corrective measures. Provide timely reports on incident response activities to senior management. Reporting: Generate regular reports on key risk indicators, performance metrics, and regulatory compliance. Present findings and insights to senior management. Collaborate with stakeholders for transparency and effective communication. NGR/GGR % per Game Control: Implement strategies to optimise Net Gaming Revenue (NGR) and Gross Gaming Revenue (GGR) percentages per game. Analyse game performance data for revenue enhancement and cost reduction. Collaborate with product and marketing teams based on data-driven insights. Required skills and qualifications Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Finance, Data Science). Strong knowledge in Excel, Google Sheets, Power BI Curacao licence & LATAM region knowledge Proven experience in iGaming risk management with a focus on data analysis. Strong knowledge of iGaming regulations and compliance requirements. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. Salary & Benefits: Competitive salary Bonus Scheme 28 days paid annual leave Career development and advancement opportunities Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Salary: Up to 50,000.00€ per year Application Question(s): Do you have knowledge of Curacao license & LATAM region? Work Location: Remote

Who are we looking for? Nearby Computing is announcing the opening of several permanent job positions for Research Engineers/Scientists, to support the research activities in the R&I areas of the company, i.e., Cloud/Edge orchestration, 5G Core/RAN management, applied Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML). The successful applicants should have a BSc, MSc or PhD degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, or any other related field. The selected candidate will: Work on the NearbyOne Edge Orchestrator, a state-of-the-art orchestration platform for network functions and 5G-ready applications. Work closely with a team Senior Researchers and other Research Engineers Support the technical activities (coding, writing deliverables, contributing to proposals) in the R&I department under the supervision of Senior Researchers Design and train novel ML models for network orchestration (only in the AI research area) Participate in national and international R&I projects Publish high quality research in top-notch peer-reviewed journals and conferences Have the opportunity to pursue a PhD in their field of work (optional) Location: Barcelona, Spain Expected starting date: March-April 2023 (flexible). Qualifications and Experience We are looking for highly motivated engineers with a strong interest in research, holding a BSc, MSc or PhD degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications or a closely related field. The required skills and experience are: Basic required qualification/skills/experience Experience with scripting and programming languages such as Python and Golang Hands-on experience with orchestration and virtualization tools like Docker, Kubernetes, OSM, OpenStack, etc. Experience in developing REST APIs Advanced experience working with Linux Ability to work with DevOps software packages such as Github and Concourse CI Experience on the design and implementation of ML algorithms (required only for the AI research area) Strong personal soft skills: communicative, highly collaborative, self-driven Other skills (valuable but not mandatory) Understanding of current technology trends in 5G/6G such as network slicing, data driven communications, virtualization and MEC/NFV Familiarity with ML frameworks and libraries, e.g., Keras or PyTorch Previous participation in national and international research projects Ability and enthusiasm to learn new technologies quickly Fluency in English (oral/writing skills) Please keep in mind that you don’t need 100% of the required qualifications to add value to our team. If you are passionate about what you could accomplish here, we would be looking forward to receiving your application. As an employer we give equal opportunities and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. If you recognize the opportunity to grow your professional career in a cutting-edge company like ours don’t miss the opportunity to apply! All applications will be treated in strict confidentiality and only short-listed candidates will be contacted. What we offer A full-time permanent position Competitive salary according to qualifications and work experience Long-term career opportunities and professional growth in a cutting-edge company Half-day Fridays Flexible working hours and ways of working Combination of presential work and tele-working Offices in the center of Barcelona city How to apply The interested researchers should send their applications in careers@nearbycomputing.com with subject “Research Engineer”. Applications should include: Full CV, including contact details of two (2) referees 1-page cover letter stating the motivation and suitability of the candidate About Nearby Computing Nearby Computing was founded in 2018 (Barcelona, Spain) and operates globally in the area of network and service orchestration, having a particular focus on the Edge Computing challenges. NearbyOne, our flagship product, is an orchestration platform that goes beyond market standards to manage all tiers of the network, from Cloud and Data Centre to the Edge, from a single pane of glass. Using a cross-domain approach, it is able to manage hybrid networks at scale through domain-specific orchestration. The solution covers all critical elements of deployment automation, i.e., from the initial Edge node provisioning to application on-boarding, to lifecycle management and QoS Assurance to SLA monitoring. Nearby Computing envisions a hyper-connected, automated, and interactive world, where communication technologies will provide immersive user experiences. The mission of our R&I department is to advance the already revolutionary areas of expertise of Nearby Computing by transforming innovative ideas to applied research. Our main goal consists in bringing value to our customers and, to a greater extent, to society through our novel state-of-the-art solutions. Our R&I department has ongoing collaborations with network operators, vertical players, large corporate partners and public authorities, while it is actively involved in several public-funded projects in various domains, including automotive, private networks and energy, among others.

Company Description  Work with Us. Change the World. At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.  About Enterprise Capabilities Enterprise Capabilities is a service-led organization within AECOM enabling access to a global talent pool. With offices in India, China, Spain, Poland, Romania and the Philippines, our teams of technical professionals provide around the clock project support helping AECOM teams around the world to deliver faster, smarter and better. EC supports AECOM’s ability to work as one global team by standardizing design processes, deploying collaboration technologies, and utilizing a connected network of technical expertise. By joining EC, you have the unique opportunity to work on AECOM’s monumental projects located around the world, contributing to our mission of delivering a better world.Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.  Job Description  Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. We are currently recruiting a CAD Technician for for in-house structural design of a wide variety of projects, including, but not limited to, bridges and viaducts; earth retaining structures, underground structures; culverts and building structures, to join our busy and expanding experienced team. The team provides assessment, concept, feasibility, preliminary and detailed designs on a wide range of projects. Our group has an established track record of successfully delivering bridge engineering design for many years, throughout the USA and Australia, not to mention Canada or Middle East. You may have the opportunity to work on some of the most iconic Transportation projects, being part of a diverse and multicultural team. It can be a great opportunity for a CAD Technician that wants to boost his/her professional career on structural drafting. The responsibilities of this role include: Analyzes and adheres to the project CAD standards. Prepares finished design drawings from sketches, notes and layout details in CAD 2D and 3D. Works in engineering project collaboration software platforms (i.e., ProjectWise, BIM360). Self-checks drawings for quality assurance, following the QAQC procedure in force in the project. Works in a team-based environment that involves coordination with colleagues based in different offices. Performs the responsibilities under limited supervision. Exceptional interpersonal skills and personal resilience to working to strict timelines/different styles of leadership.  Additional Information  Minimum Requirements +5 years experience working as CAD Technician on bridges and structures. Expert in the use of CAD software (preferable AutoCAD and/or MicroStation). Software accreditation will be considered favourable. Proficiency in drafting using Autodesk Revit deriving drawings from 3D models will be considered favourable. Experienced using common data environments Autodesk Construction Cloud (BIM360) and Bentley ProjectWise Communicative level of English (oral and written). Experience working for Transport Authority clients in the USA, Canada and Australia will be considered favourable  Preferred Qualifications Certificated in a drafting technology Institute Technical or similar Professional Education. About AECOM AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.  Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

titulo: Data Visualization Engineer - EY GDS Spain - Hybrid
descripcion: The opportunity  We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Visualization Engineer to join our team. The primary purpose of this role is to design and develop visual representations of complex data sets using tools such as Power BI and Tableau. The ideal candidate should be an expert in data visualization and a proficient user of Azure and Python to manipulate data and integrate with other tools as needed.  As a member of our team in the EY GDS Spain office in Malaga, you'll have a chance to extend your knowledge & experience by working on interesting projects with the newest technologies and approaches. You'll support clients in choosing the most suitable business solution and take part in digital transformation.  Your key responsibilities  Design, develop, and maintain dynamic dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI and/or Tableau Work closely with stakeholders and data scientists to understand their data needs and objectives, and translate them into intuitive, interactive, and effective visualizations Develop custom visualizations using DAX, M, Python, and other related languages Perform data modeling, data preparation, and data integration tasks using Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, and/or Azure Data Lake Collaborate with the development team to ensure data quality, system performance, and security  Skills and attributes for success  Excellent communication and collaboration skills The ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders  To qualify for the role, you must have  Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field At least 3 years of professional experience in data visualization design and development, with a strong focus on Power BI and Tableau Strong knowledge of data modeling and data analytics using Azure services, such as Azure SQL, Synapse, etc. Extensive experience in data modeling, data preparation, and data integration using SQL, ETL, and other related tools Comfortable working with APIs, JSON, Parquet, and other data formats Fluent in English is a must  Ideally, you’ll also have  Demonstrated ability to design and build data visualizations that effectively communicate complex data insights to various audiences Experience in international environments  What we look for  We are interested in hiring a proactive professional who will work effectively as an international team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication, and updating senior team members on progress and relevant matters. As an ideal candidate, you should have a personal drive and positive work ethic to deliver results within tight deadlines and in demanding situations.  What we offer  In EY GDS Spain, you will collaborate with our teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills, and insights that will stay with you throughout your career. Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching, and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  About EY GDS  EY Global Delivery Services (EY GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network of over 75,000 people working across the world, to provide innovative and strategic business solutions to our clients worldwide. We play a vital role in growth strategy, helping our clients become agile and efficient, and helping fulfill our purpose to build a better working world.  From accountants to coders, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. We look for skills that are evergreen and our roles evolve with industry trends. We also work across Finance, Business Development, Technology, Talent, Procurement and Risk Management functions to help our teams operate as efficiently and effectively as possible.  Across our 10 locations and 21 cities, we work with teams from all service lines, geographies, and sectors. We operate in Argentina, China, Hungary, India, the Philippines, Poland, Sri Lanka, Mexico, Spain and the United Kingdom.  Our EY GDS Spain office is located at Malaga Technology Park and currently employs over 750 people.  If you are interested in being part of our team, we kindly invite you to get in touch with us.  The exceptional EY GDS experience. It’s yours to build.
