What you will do: You will be responsible for the operational excellence of many critical services that must run reliably 24/7 and scale with increasing traffic and complexity. You will work on research, development, stress testing, and rollout of new services and infrastructure. You will work with SWE's to make sure systems have proper logging, monitoring, alerting, and on-call's. You must be great at debugging and figuring out problems that inevitably come up in production. Job requirements: Deep experience with Linux systems and internet technologies (DNS, TLS, SMTP, HTTP) Deep experience with infrastructure automation (Puppet, Terraform, OpenNebula, Kubernetes) Deep experience with scripting (Bash, Python) Experience managing and scaling data storage (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, Kafka, Elastic, Ceph, ClickHouse) Able to operate in a fast environment with teammates in other continents and take on-call's Excellent English communications, both written and spoken Bonus: worked with production email systems (Postfix) or blockchains (Bitcoin) Why should you join Proton? Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable. Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH. Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more. Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields. Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do. Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities. Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

Company Description  Work with Us. Change the World. At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 55,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.  Job Description  Our Environmental team currently has an exciting vacancy for a Remediation Consultant to be based in our Madrid office. The successful candidate will work in a dynamic team which undertakes a wide variety of projects, pulling the right resources from across the company to support project needs. These projects involve, but are not limited to, contaminated soil investigation and remediation, risk assessments, remedial design, implementation and follow-up. The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to: Performs specific and limited portions of a broader assignment of an experienced engineer. Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using established and well-defined procedures. Works on detailed or routine engineering assignments involving calculations and relatively simple tests. Proposes approach to solve new problems encountered. Identifies discrepancies in results. Provides guidance to entry level engineers. Performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule with moderate supervision.  Qualifications Candidate must have a Bachelor's or master’s degree in Engineering (Environmental, Chemical, Mining, Forest, Civil, Agricultural or Industrial) or Geology, Chemistry, Biology or Environmental Science, or another technical, environmental or chemical field of study. Previous experience in Remediation, at least 3-4 years. Excellent communication skills in English and Spanish. Good knowledge and use of industry-standard computer software such as GIS, Surfer or Voxler. Solid attention to detail and thorough approach to work. Reasonable flexibility and willingness to travel to and work at site locations where/when required.. A valid driver's license  Additional Information  About AECOM AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.  Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Science & Technology: Lead Technology development from idea to Proof of Concept/Process, including design of new equipment/ingredient production. Explore science-driven technological solutions in the field of biopolymers to bring competitive advantage. Generate structure design routes for texturization of food biopolymers (proteins and polysaccharides) Execute experimental research activities, analyze data, and test hypotheses. Continuously build knowledge on the latest trends in Biopolymer science, with a focus on process-controlled structuring for rheology design and elucidating new ingredient physicochemical-textural functions. Contribute to the design of new processes based on the generated biopolymer structuring/texturization routes. Develop predictive, mathematical models for structure-rheology functions. Contribute to patent drafting and scientific substantiation of patent claims. Co-define Technology Transfer plans, ensure resources and anticipate needs. Engage in fundamental research with academic partners to address key scientific challenges. Develop and build strong relations with academia and Research Centres. Contribute to scientific publications and presentations in top International Scientific Conferences. Document knowledge about the latest methods and scientific advancements in the field. Project & People Management: Contribute to shaping S&T focus areas and project pipeline. Define resources and equipment needs. Coach and guide Food Tech Researchers and PhD / MS students. Promote cross-fertilization of ideas and technologies between the different S&T Pillars. Technical Assistance: Provide subject matter expertise to the R&D Product Development team and other departments. Active involvement in technology scaling up and implementation activities when needed. Requirements: ➔ Care about our mission and see it as a “personal” problem to be solved professionally. ➔ Scientist I: A Ph.D. in biopolymers (proteins, polysaccharides) with expertise in material science and physical techniques for texture generation. ➔ +7 years of postgraduate or industry (Technology or applied science research) experience. ➔ Research experience in polymer texturization technologies e.g. extrusion, shear cell, power heating, and spinning technologies. ➔ Knowledge and/or research experience in texture generation and relevant characterization techniques e.g. Rheology, Tribology, Texture Analysis. ➔ Knowledge and/or research experience in surface engineering design and relevant characterization techniques is a benefit e.g. Contact Angle Goniometry, Zeta Potential - surface charge. ➔ Train and coach technology researchers and students on relevant characterization techniques, if needed. ➔ Experience using predictive modeling tools (e.g. MatLab) for modeling process-microstructure and/or microstructure textural properties is a plus. ➔ A strong sense of science for application and interest in novel technologies. ➔ Fluency in English.  Benefits: To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with: Limitless professional development at Europe's fastest-growing company in its category. Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback. An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation. 22 regulatory Spanish labor days + 5 extra ones! of holidays. Flexible working environment. Private Health Insurance. Organic coffee and tea. Discounted gym memberships. Discounts on Heura’s products. Flexible retribution. After-work gatherings every month and other cool company events.

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead. At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors. As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment. Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role Link is a pillar in the Veeva system landscape that envisions “Connecting life sciences and key people to improve research and care.” Our product offers real-time academics, social, and medical data to build comprehensive profiles. These profiles help our life-science industry partners find the right experts to accelerate the development and the adoption of new therapeutics. We accelerate clinical trials and equitable care. We are proud that our work helps patients receive their most urgent care sooner. Your work will shape the product roadmap for the entire family of Link products, especially newer products such as Link for Trials. You will design and create an end-to-end pipeline to extract predefined categories of information from big unstructured data in multi-domain and multi-lingual setups. You will have access to cloud infrastructure to develop your model and support from a team of software developers and DevOps engineers to deploy it to production. We want to develop new algorithms to redefine the industry expectations for quality vs. quantity compromise. We train ML models empowered by over 1900 curators to meet both the quality and the scale requirements. ML models complement and learn from continuous curation and scale our solutions to different regions, languages, and medical specialties. We invite you to work remotely from any area within this country. However, it’s a prerequisite that you already reside in this country and hold legal work authorization without needing an employer’s support. If you plan to move to this country or live nearby, we may still consider your application if you’re a superb fit for the role. In such scenarios, kindly supply an extra document that outlines your impending or current location, visa status, and the reasons that make you an excellent fit. What You’ll Do Develop machine learning models at scale and in the AWS cloud to structure and analyze scientific data Adopt the latest technologies and trends in AI Use and develop named entity recognition, entity-linking, slot-filling, few-shot learning, active learning, dense passage retrieval, and other statistical techniques and models for information extraction and machine reading Deeply understand and analyze our data model per data source and geo-region and interpret model decisions Collaborate with data quality teams to define annotation tasks, metrics, and perform a qualitative and quantitative evaluation Collaborate with engineering teams to implement models at a terminal scale Requirements 8+ years of experience as a data scientist (or 6+ years with a relevant Ph.D. degree) Fluent in Python/Java and bashing scripts Excellent analytical skills and data curiosity Superior communication and presentation skills Mastery in at least one framework for BigData (e.g. Spark, DASK) and one framework for Deep Learning (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch) Mastery of Machine Learning, including up-to-date knowledge of the latest ML innovations and frameworks Used to start-up environments Social competence and a team player High energy and ambitious Agile mindset Nice to Have Experience in life/health science industry, notably pharma Background in clinical (trial) data Having published in AI space in a peer-reviewed journal/conference Production-grade development Skills Cloud development, especially AWS Experience in NLP, NER, deduplication, entity-linking, graph-processing, or reinforcement learning Leadership skills and a solid network to help in hiring and growing the team Experience in containerization, Kubernetes, or relevant distributed computing technologies Experience with NoSQL databases, especially MongoDB Familiarity with model registry solutions such as MLflow Perks & Benefits Work anywhere Personal development budget Veeva charitable giving program Fitness reimbursement Life insurance + pension fund Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

descripcion: stellar opportunity to make a massive impact: push the boundaries for how Happy.Rentals customers find the best possible vacation rental for their trip. Our Supply Connectivity team is responsible for reliably connecting our customers to diversified sources of vacation rental home inventory so that we can always offer the best possible deal to our users at the best possible price. As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for scaling, improving and operating our direct integrations platform with large channel managers, property management systems, OTAs, and other partners across the board. You’ll work with a highly skilled team of technical, data and product-focused individuals, whose mission is to consistently find and deliver the best vacation rental home deals and inventory for our customers. We are looking for team members with strong backend engineering, API, and analytical skills. Everything we do is focused on customer experience, data measurement and delivering value at speed. You’ll be responsible for making that a reality. Requirements 3+ years professional experience building and maintaining systems at scale. Experience in building and managing multiple external API integrations. Professional experience developing data heavy platforms or APIs. Thrived in backend engineering positions and delivered user experiences at scale. Ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table. Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Mobile Engineers, and other highly skilled specialists. Passionate about quality and writing testable code that performs and scales. Professional programming experience with Core PHP & API integration. Able to write neat & clean code with good logic flow. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.  Responsibilities Build, own and generally maintain our vendor API integration microservices. Evolve and maintain our architecture, including monitoring and alerting systems. · Contribute to improvements in a microservices architecture system. · Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback to foster growth. · Seize great opportunities, helping Happy.Rentals rise to the top of the vacation rental home and travel industries. Apply for this job

What will you do? As a Cloud System Administrator, you will work closely with other Technology Teams, owning the deployment, operation and support of our on-premise and cloud-based production systems, ensuring the availability, performance, scalability and security of the environments. As well as automation of the company’s operations and processes and support and maintenance of all the applications developed in the company. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team with which you will develop innovative solutions that fonYou implements for telecommunications operators around the world. fonYou most innovative technologies and methodology: Agile methodologies and Scrum oriented team Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning processes and solutions Data analysis and big data cloud pipelines in collaboration with our Data Scientist team Java developments (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Maven, Hibernate, …) Multi-language developments (Go, Kotlin, NodeJS, Lua, Python, …) SQL and NoSQL databases (MySQL, Cassandra, Redis, Datastore, Dataproc, …) Design and deploying microservices in container technologies: Docker, Kubernetes. Continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) and DevOps oriented developments Robust and scalable Cloud computing architectures, integrating most innovative GCP serverless solutions Soft Skills: Enthusiastic and passionate about embracing technology innovation in an ever-changing industry and solve new challenges. Highly motivated to continuous improvement and change Autonomous and objective driven Responsible and organized person Love to learn new technologies and solve new challenges Pro-active and self-learning attitude Excellent teammate, with a passion for working with others and who works with integrity to succeed in a high-energy, dynamic environment. Good communication skills Problem-solving abilities and creative thinking Hard Skills: IaaS: Experience in the deployment and administration of cloud environments Google Cloud and / or AWS, minimum 3 years. Code for automation: experience writing code that facilitates automation processes with bash / shell, Ruby, Python, Golang. Continuous integration: experience with tools to automate CI pipelines such as Jenkins. Configuration and containers: desirable experience with technologies for configuration and handling of containers / clusters such as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Chef, Puppet or Ansible. Linux: solid knowledge managing Linux operating systems. Data processing: deep knowledge configuring performance monitoring systems. Using the ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana). Networking knowledge: IP addressing, VLANs, TCP sockets, Wireshark, etc. Interest on the trends of T.I. and good practices of DevOps. Native or fluent in Spanish English B2 or above You will be working at our newly refurbished and expanded headquarters in Barcelona, with excellent facilities for all employees. A part of your work time will be remote (teleworking). We look forward to hearing from you!

Unirte a Deloitte es participar en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales. En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti  ¿Te sumas?  Director IA/Analytics especializado en sector Banca, CMR-Consumer y Farma  Desde Deloitte AI&Data utilizamos datos para ofrecer a los clientes soluciones innovadoras, ayudándoles en la toma de decisiones, para ello usamos herramientas de Big Data, Data Science y Analytics como Spark, Hadoop, MongoDB, Apache, Hyve, R, Python, entre otras.  El profesional será responsable de liderar la actividad comercial para desarrollar negocio alrededor de proyectos de Analítica e Inteligencia Artificial para clientes del Sector Banca y CMR. Asimismo, liderará un equipo de analistas para llevar a cabo dichos proyectos, supervisando la recopilación, análisis e informes de resultados. Sus principales responsabilidades incluirán:  Liderar las transformaciones empresariales del negocio por el impacto de la AI y del Data avanzado. Discurso de negocio en interlocución con CxO de las compañías Actividad comercial para activar proyectos de Analítica e Inteligencia Artificial en el Sector Energía. Dirigir un equipo de analistas para recopilar, limpiar y analizar grandes conjuntos de datos en proyectos relacionados con el sector energético. Crear y presentar informes y visualizaciones que comuniquen de manera clara y concisa información compleja sobre datos. Colaborar con Managers, Data Scientists, Analistas en la consecución de los proyectos. Mantenerse actualizado con las últimas tendencias, tecnologías y mejores prácticas de la industria relacionadas con el análisis de datos y el sector energético. Experiencia demostrable en transformaciones empresariales de clientes o de servicios relacionados  REQUISITOS SOLICITADOS PARA EL PUESTO (p.e. estudios)  Doble grado o grado en un campo relacionado (como matemáticas, estadísticas, informática o ingeniería) Grado en un dominio de los requeridos en negocio con carrera alineada en el trabajo de AI o Data. Master después de su carrera en negocio MBA o especialidad aplicable. Al menos 7 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, actividad comercial con un enfoque en el sector energético Capacidad para liderar equipos y entregar proyectos exitosos de análisis de datos en el sector energético. Habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas, con experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis estadístico y visualización de datos. Conocimiento de herramientas y software de análisis de datos (como Python, R, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) Habilidades de comunicación, con la capacidad de presentar información compleja de manera clara y concisa. Habilidades de liderazgo, con la capacidad de motivar e inspirar a los miembros del equipo para que alcancen sus objetivos. Pasión por la innovación, el aprendizaje y la mejora continua en el campo del análisis de datos y el sector energético. Capacidad para liderar proyectos internacionales Nivel de inglés C1.  ¿Qué te ofrecemos?  Contarás con un modelo de trabajo híbrido-flexible Podrás optar a un sistema de retribución flexible, servicio médico, seguro de salud, seguro de vida y accidente Contarás con un plan de formación a lo largo de tu trayectoria profesional Te desarrollarás en una cultura de feedback donde fomentar tu aprendizaje continuo Participarás si te interesa en programas de acción social y voluntariado de alcance nacional e internacional Disfrutarás de una oferta cultural y deportiva  ¡Ahora la decisión es tuya! Si crees que este puesto está hecho para ti, haz clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil para que podamos valorar tu solicitud. Si encajas en el perfil, nuestro equipo de captación se pondrá en contacto contigo para conocerte.  A partir de ahí te iremos guiando por nuestro proceso de selección y comenzará tu historia en Deloitte.  What impact will you make?  Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social. Ubicación: Barcelona Tipo de puesto: Profesionales con experiencia Línea de servicio: CONSULTING Req Id: 37366
